boardgame.name: Double Dose
boardgame.description:
Double Dose is a wild, drink-giving card game. It's a sequel to Dose that's playable alone or in conjunction with the original game. Compared to basic Dose, Double Dose includes cards that make players reveal truths, perform dares, and share their deepest, darkest history. It also integrates an online function that allows players to reload random rule, dare, truth, and never-have-I-ever suggestions via the website: dosecards.com.

Players race to play or trade all of their cards. Each card can change the color, advance the game, or make your friends drink. Cards are played on their color, but some cards allow players to trade their entire decks or otherwise change the game dynamics wildly. The winner is the first player to play all the cards.

Similar to UNO, once a player only has two cards, they must shout, "Dose!" before another player realizes it or else they must drink and draw two cards.

boardgame.name: セーノ (Seeno)
boardgame.description:
セーノ (Seeno) is a two player card game from Japan. Using the theme and gameplay of rock, scissors, paper, the game has three characters, グー (Gū), チョキ (Choki), パーで (Pā de). Each player gets six cards, numbered 1 to 3, which count as hits to win draws. These three battle it out but also have special abilities on action cards. A quick game that children and adults can pick up easily.
user summary

boardgame.name: Nexum Galaxy: Asteroids
boardgame.description:
In the Nexum Galaxy "Asteroids" Expansion you will find a greater depth of gameplay in the story and asymmetric features of the Civilizations, with technologies, exploration, new resources, wormholes that will connect us to other Sectors, etc.

With this expansion, Nexum Galaxy becomes a 4X game (eXplore, eXpand, eXploit and eXterminate).

It also introduces an asymmetry in factions, technology, new resources. It increases replayability by adding new Systems to those included in the base game, as well as Event and AI cards.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: PHONEY WAR
boardgame.description:
PHONEY WAR is a WWII war game.
Play as West Allies, Germans or Soviets in the two modes of play:
2 Players: Prelude to War
3 Players: Race to Berlin
Both game modes use most of the same rules and components.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Rank and Vile
boardgame.description:
Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Rank and Vile

Three more mighty armies for your arsenal! The troops and tanks of the innumerable Astra Militarum are ready and willing to fight for the Emperor! The dark and twisted Drukhari are poised to spring out of the warp to loot and plunder across the galaxy. Chaos marches to war with hordes of Daemons from each of the four mighty lords.

Alongside these three forces are new Treasures like the Shadowsword tank and notable monsters like Rotigus to make your Munchkin Warhammer 40,000 game even more massive!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Strike Force
boardgame.description:
https://www.mobygames.com/game/strike-force

A re-imagination of Defender which expands the concept with several new features. 22 human colonies on the galactic frontier are stricken by the Saurian menace, a reptilian alien species which promptly sets about attacking all planets in the sector, mutating and enslaving the hapless colonists. An emergency strike force has been assembled to repel the invaders, with the ultimate goal of destroying the enemy's supreme battleship - Apocalypse, the Saurian Megastar.

The basic premise remains two-way horizontally scrolling action as you fly your Aerial Jet Fighter over the planets' surfaces, attacking the invaders and protecting the colonists. Added to your arsenal are a new array of selectable weapons, from mines and homing rockets to devastating air-strikes and atomics; these can be restocked at the interstellar supply center. You also command a small army of space marines in jet-powered battle suits, which can be deployed to collect power-ups, retrieve colonists and add to your firepower. Two simultaneous players may engage the enemy side by side.

The unpleasant, neon-green intruders will fight back with anything they can get their hands on, from rocks and handheld weapons to enormous flying death machines. It's up to you to decide which planets to attack, in what order, and when to engage the Megastar in a final battle.

boardgame.name: The Date
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

There, that's it. The moment. The moment you knew there was a spark.

Sure, they're attractive, but it's that glimmer in their eyes that drew you in. That quick flash of smile.

You dive in with a heady rush, but will you swim or drown?

The Date is a solo romance RPG on a single page. It is the second game created using the Second Guess System first used in the One White Eye RPG. Here, the system of impending dread and self deception is instead turned to the uncertainty and trepidation of a first date with your new crush. All you need are a d20, a d6, and something to record your journal entries on.

Sometimes people surprise you.

boardgame.name: Temple of Rubbo
boardgame.description:
A shipwrecked crew of cursed pirates are condemned to an animal form... Armed with nothing but their desire to be human again, they decide to enter... the TEMPLE of RUBBO.

Delve deep into the dungeon below and fight rats, slimes, goblins, knights and demons. Use swords, spears, bows and magic through 16 floors of dungeons to rescue the ancient wizard!

Can you lift the curse from your crew?

Features

? Play co-op with 1-4 players
? Explore 5 unique areas
?️ Procedurally generated dungeons - different each time!
? 120 items to find
?️ Over 30+ enemies to fight
? 4 different kinds of shops
? 4 bossfights and 4 minibosses
? 10 playable characters
? Original Soundtrack of over 15 songs by @bbtombo!
? 3+ hours of playtime
Pick-up and play ?
The game is very easy to get in to: with only three buttons and a clear objective, you can get all your friends playing in just a couple of minutes. No tedious tutorial to get through!

New run, new build! ?‍♀️
Each run, you'll come across shops, witches and a blacksmith which you can use to buy gear and level up your character. Will you become a powerful knight, a swift archer or an intelligent battle mage? It's all up to you!

Fast-paced Fun ⏳
The game is very fast paced: you only have three minutes before each floor begins to disintegrate. It's stressful, but it also means that a full run will not take you longer than about 45 minutes!

Co-op ?‍♂️?
You can play TEMPLE of RUBBO with up to 4 players! If you have no controllers, it's 1-2 players. If you do, you can either use 4 controllers, or mix-and-match with keyboard players if you don't have enough.

No-one around? The game is balanced in such a way that it is also a lot of fun to play on your own!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Nova-Raiders
boardgame.description:
A fast-paced, competitive, space challenge for 2-4 players.

You are a Nova Raider, part prospector and part pirate, in this space age race for riches. Compete with other Raiders to collect the valuable energy crystals surrounding an unstable star. Grab as much as you can before the expanding star consumes everything in its path, including you.

Use your dice to Hop between Teleports or fly around the Orbit Rings to collect Energy Crystals. Gather these crystals under your ship and try to bring them back to your Space Dock before somebody Hijacks your cargo. The time track is constantly moving forward, triggering the addition of more energy and the dangerous expansion of the star. The expanding star consumes everything in its path, until it goes Super-Nova, ending the game. Whoever collects the most energy before the Star goes Super-Nova will win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Viridian: Final Reckoning
boardgame.description:
The sprawling Great Bear Rainforest of British Columbia has remained untouched by humankind. It’s thousand year old red cedars and 300 foot Sitka spruces shadow uncharted paths. The forest has grown wild and unscathed. Until now.

In humanity’s quest for wealth and resources they have pushed further and further into the dense overgrowth. Only this time they’ve traversed too far. In the depths of this Canadian forest lies the Viridian, an army of animals sworn to protect their home. Once content to hide, these high functioning animals with human-like cognition have nowhere left to go. It’s time to fight.

The attack against the invading human forces is led by Viridian High Marshal Caal, a vicious, but aging gorilla. He has championed Viridian since his escape from the Vancouver Zoo and united a ragtag group of animals who were also seeking safety. The group became organized and strengthened under his leadership, but now he is looking for a successor. You, a young general, must join this fight.

Every game of Viridian: Final Reckoning represents a battle against the humans. Your goal is to defeat as many enemies as possible - place enough of your troops within striking distance to take them down. Every defeated enemy is another addition to your war resume. Additionally, every battle has specific goals you must meet in order to survive. Regardless of your score, if you do not meet the mission goal, you die. Not only are you battling for survival, but you’re also fighting to become the next leader of Viridian. The player with the highest score becomes the next Viridian High Marshal.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: El Juego de Cartas – El Camino a Carcosa: Expansión de Campaña
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Path to Carcosa: Campaign Expansion
boardgame.description:
A repackaging of the Path to Carcosa cycle. All of the player cards for the cycle can be found in the Path to Carcosa Investigator Expansion while all the encounter cards and campaign cards can be found in the Path to Carcosa Campaign Expansion.
—user summary

"I cannot forget Carcosa where black stars hang in the heavens; where the shadow of men’s thoughts lengthen in the afternoon, when the twin suns sink into the lake of Hali; and my mind will bear for ever the memory of the Pallid Mask." –Robert W. Chambers, The King in Yellow

A new theater production is coming to Arkham all the way from Paris. Unsurprisingly, it's been all the rage in conversations among Arkham's socialites. But in your efforts to learn more about the play, you've uncovered a darker history. Disappearances. Suicides. Delusions. Insanity. Wherever The King in Yellow is performed, madness follows close behind…

In The Path to Carcosa, the second deluxe expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game, it becomes your task to uncover the secrets of this unusual play. The expansion's two scenarios kick off The Path to Carcosa campaign with a trip to the Ward Theatre and an invitation to the formal dinner party hosted by cast and crew. But with every answer you gain and every clue you uncover, you only find yourself falling deeper into mystery and madness.
—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: BGExpansions Track Tokens
boardgame.description:
3 track tokens for Terraforming Mars.

Each token has the same base size as the plastic track tokens that are originally included in the game.

Contents (3 pieces):
1 Oxygen token (red)
1 Temperature token (blue)
1 Turn token (yellow)

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: BGExpansions Draft Coin
boardgame.description:
Draft coin for Terraforming Mars.

Serves as 1st player marker and indicates the drafting direction when playing with the alternative drafting rules.

boardgame.name: Thorgal: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Thorgal: The Board Game is a co-operative storybook adventure game in which 1-4 players take on the roles of Thorgal, his wife Aaricia, their son Jolan, and Kriss —a deadly female warrior — and go on a series of adventures.

The game consists of ten stand-alone scenarios, each taking roughly 90-120 minutes of play. Scenarios neither form a campaign nor have any legacy features, so they can be played by different playgroups and over an extended period of time.

Thorgal: The Board Game comes with a book of maps. Each scenario is played on a different map that players explore while fulfilling scenario goals and promises completely different adventures, hidden opportunities, and vivid characters. Players are free to choose whether they travel in one group or split to cover more areas at the same time. They also perform side quests that might help them win a scenario.

Another important feature in the game is the storybook that contains narrative descriptions of the encounters that characters make in each scenario. The adventures described in the book are specific to each scenario and character, yet a lot of them are randomized within a scenario, allowing for repeated play. Characters' morality and past decisions all play an important role in how the encounters are resolved.

Thorgal: The Board Game, while having a strong narrative element, offers a fan-favorite action selection mechanism. Similar to games like Puerto Rico or Race for the Galaxy, on each turn the active player chooses an action to be performed by the entire group, with the active player executing its full version, and all passive players performing its weaker version, regardless of their location on the map. This creates an interesting decision space and makes each turn important for everyone at the table.

Another important mechanism involves character development. Their abilities are upgraded during gameplay and negatively affected by wounds suffered in fighting. Characters gather resources and craft objects to help them survive in the dangerous world and gain companions they meet on the way.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Luckitown
boardgame.description:
Luckitown is a turn-based tower defense where you roll dice to
build new structures and cast spells to defend your town.

Gameplay

collect new dice by investing in economy buildings such as farms, workshop and
markets. some new dice will come with new resource types!

place your buildings strategically!
for example, workshops make new dice but will also repair surrounding
buildings, beacons increase the range of surrounding buildings and
menhirs create new magic dice, but will produce more slowly if other buildings are close by.

plan your dice and let fate decide your future!
if you're trying to build a specific thing, you can hold dice so they won't reroll.

Features

13 different resource types
4 boss fights
over 40 different buildings/actions to play
2-4 hours playtime depending on how fast you play

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: DUNGEONBALL
boardgame.description:
DUNGEONBALL is a first-person dodgeball roguelike. Use your hands and throwing power to fight your way through the dungeons.

You'll also use your hands to block enemy attacks, to carry keys around, and hold potions if you want to save them for later.

Slowly fight your way through the procedurally generated levels - how deep into the dungeons can you get?

Features

Fun physics-based combat with emergent elements
Procedurally generated dungeons with ever increasing difficulty
Pick up nasty slimes and throw 'em against the wall
~1 hour of gameplay

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Home Sweet Home (or Not)
boardgame.description:
The sun shines through the window, the aroma of recently cooked food wafts through the kitchen, and the dining room looks splendid as it awaits the guests. Everything's pointing to a memorable Sunday — except for the flying dish that just smashed into the attic. Why does this stuff always happen to us?

In the co-operative board game Home Sweet Home (or Not), 2-5 players must collaborate to complete the objectives laid out in one of the five missions included in the game. Each mission requires a different layout of the house, which is constructed of different rooms connected by 3D wooden doors.

Each player represents a family member who must spend action points to recover objects from the rooms and return them to their correct places according to the mission. Will you be able to get all of the stuff out of the rooms and into the attic before the aliens abduct you? Can you help Santa Claus load all of the presents into the sled that's parked in your garage?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Apocalich
boardgame.description:
Apocalich is an RPG where you race against time to defeat the Lich King, alone or couch co-op with friends!

The Lich King takes about 20 days to spread evil and activate magic towers that make him stronger and stronger.

On the 20th day (after ~1,5 hour gameplay) the Lich is all powered up and prompts the final fight, win this fight and you win game!
However, if you lose the final fight, you'll have to start all over.

The entire map is visible at all times!
You can see what the Lich is up to while you are going on quests and rebuilding the world.
Sometimes events will happen on the other side of the map, will you be in time to intervene?
Maybe you'll need to fix the bridge and help the boat service get back on track to be somewhere in time.

Remember to talk to all the NPCs!

Whenever you cross paths with an enemy a battle window pops ups.
During battles use action commands to block incoming attacks and deal critical hits.
Some skill even require multiple action commands to perform well!

If you or someone else walks behind a battle window, they will join the fight!
Watch out for sudden backup, or help out a friend in need!

an exciting map where everything is visible at all times!
~1,5 hour of gameplay per save. if you lose, you start over!
up to 4 player local multiplayer! fight together and go on your quests separately.
loads of items, skills and quests to find
real-time battles with action commands!
Can you figure out how to save the land from despair?

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Learning Factory
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





PLAY WITH MACHINE LEARNING
Learning Factory is relaxing factory building game about the most important thing - making Cats happy. Optimize and automate production chains. Sell crafted items to cats and improve service with Machine Learning. Rebuild the ancient Monument to establish Catopia on Mars.The game is backed up with real Machine Learning, links to handpicked educational videos, and an in-game wiki to be used as learning material.

Renovate a factory on Mars
Automate production and sales
Collect and analyze tons of data
Research, scale, optimize and learn

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – T'au Empire
boardgame.description:
The T’au are a young and dynamic race of technologically advanced aliens whose empire is spreading like wildfire across the stars. Ruled and guided by the enigmatic Ethereals, the T’au seek to unite every sentient being under the light of the T’au’va, or Greater Good. They prefer that others join this growing alliance willingly, but do not hesitate to use force to fulfil their destiny wherever they must. At the forefront of this fight are the Hunter Cadres of the Fire Caste. Comprising highly mobile and well-armed soldiery, led and supported by veteran warriors piloting deadly battlesuits, gunships and strike fighters, these armies sweep all before them in a blizzard of devastating firepower. Signature battle strategies such as the decisive Mont’ka or the cunning ambush of the Kauyon see the enemy outmanoeuvred at every turn, while their potent blend of technological might and ideological fanaticism ensure the T’au achieve victory after victory.

This 136-page book comprehensively covers the T'au Empire. It has everything you need to bring the technological might of the T'au to bear on the tabletop in order to expand the empire, plus a selection of lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this hardback codex you'll find:


The origins of the T'au Empire, their desire for unity through the Greater Good, and their will to expand as a species
A detailed description T'au's caste-based society, the various Spheres of Expansion, the Septs that form the Empire, and the technological and military might of the T'au
Background information on the Ethereals, as well as characters such as Aun'Shi, Shadowsun, and Commander Farsight
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
37 datasheets for the units that make up the T'au forces, from squads of Fire Warriors, to incredible Battlesuits, and heavily armed tanks
Battle-forged rules that represent how the T'au wage war, from Sept Tenets, Cadre Commands, Independent Powers, as well as Bespoke Stratagems, Prototype Systems, and more.
Crusade Rules that let you bring the Greater Good to various planets through overpowering force and subtle diplomacy
And more!


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Klangraupe
boardgame.description:
Klangraupe is a memo game. The matching pairs have the same name in German, but look completely different (homonyms).

Klangraupe ist ein Memo-Spiel. Passende Paare heissen gleich, sehen aber ganz unterschiedlich aus (Homonyme).

boardgame.name: Michael Coe's Dungeon Heroes
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Dungeon!

Two players go Head-to-Head controlling opposing sides in a game of deduction and deceit. One player controls a party of four heroes adventuring into a dungeon for treasure. The other is the Dungeon Lord who reigns over the dungeon's traps, treasures, and monsters. The heroes' party consists of a Warrior, a Cleric, a Rogue, and a Wizard, who must work together, using each of their special abilities to overcome the puzzles presented by the scheming Dungeon Lord.

—description from the back of the box

Contains Dungeon Heroes, and the Dungeon Heroes Expansion Pack.

boardgame.name: Star Wars Customizable Card Game: Hoth Limited Expansion Set
boardgame.description:
It's a bleak time for the Rebellion. The Dark forces of the Empire have driven the Rebel forces into excile on the ice planet of Hoth.

This was the first set to include images from The Empire Strikes Back. It was also the first set to introduce the mechanic of a "persona", a version of a main character with alternate abilities (e.g., Commander Luke Skywalker vs. Luke Skywalker).

Also included in this set were the immense AT-AT walkers. Another new rule was the "Hoth Energy Shield Rules" which prevents the Dark Side player from deploying his cards on the first four "marker" Hoth sites, and all interior Hoth sites; unless the Main Power Generators is "blown away".

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #15 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magical items like the abyssal carcass, deceptive dagger, ring of foe focus, and circlet of the imperial dragon!

• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like soulpiercer, seize the heart, dimensional maw, and scarf of slashing steel!

• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the accursed witch, close quarters fighter, and college of the passage!

• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the hypnotic gloomwing, the helpful domovoi, and the deadly tenebrous worm!

boardgame.name: Calidar: A Players' Guide to Alfdaín
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This players' guide is associated with its core gazetteer CAL3 Alfdaín Ascendant, expanding Calidar's Series 3 collection. It offers the players basic information on Alfdaín's land, people, and history. The bulk of the guide focuses on the elves with up to seven sub-races, each with unique natural abilities and character class adaptations. The last chapter is written in the style of a traveler's brochure, touching upon currency, places to see or shop, local news, and yearly festivals. Maps of Alfdaín and its capital city are included in the printed book. The street map is also offered in digital format along with the book's PDF file, at the full 300 dpi resolution, with its levels and legends on a separate layer that can be toggled off/on.

boardgame.name: Pain of Broken Heart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a Valentine's Day-themed level-7 adventure that tells the story of Madeline Luna. She was once a fair, beautiful woman. But one day she seduced the wrong man and angered his sorceress wife. A curse turned her into a fiend, a succubus. The foul incantation makes her crave the love of a person. But the fiend inside her murders all those she loves... It is a horrible condition... For decades she has roamed the world looking for a way to end this without success..

A few months ago, she reached yet another city in her countless travels. There, a man named Thomas Gartney fell in love with her, but he didn't finch nor felt fear when she told him the truth. He was willing to help her and he did. Together, they have worked for weeks to develop a cure. Thomas understands she must see other people and kill them to quench her murderous desires. This keeps him alive. Furthermore, the only magic Madeline knows is necromancy. The souls and blood of living subjects is needed for their plans to work. The many people she has killed has drawn too much attention. Will they be able to fulfill their plans and see their love thrive?

This is a level 7 adventure with a bit of exploration, quandaries of love, and a confrontation with the worst of humanity's hubris and degeneracy!

boardgame.name: 13 Weird One-Shots
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ancient world of Harth withers beneath its dying sun…but it’s not dead yet.

The land is still riddled with villages in danger, cultists in caves, angels gone mad, eldritch horrors making strange deals, raging dragons, bandits in the woods, and cruel monsters lurking in every shadow.

These 13 adventures span a wide variety of locations, environments, creatures, and genres. They are meant for use as quick-play sessions or one-shots, or to be dropped into campaigns as side-quests. These are linear dungeons and mini-quests full of interactivity and strangeness, encouraging exploration, risk-taking, and creative combat.

ADVENTURE TYPE: One-Shot / Low Level / Combat / Exploration / Village / Wilderness / City / Subterranean / Dungeon Delve

DESIGN NOTES

These 13 adventures are intended for low-level characters around Level 3
Overall, these adventures tend to be linear dungeon delves in caves or single buildings
93 unique encounter locations
69 original magic items
71 original monsters (with 28 illustrations)
13 maps/diagrams
Each adventure runs 2-4 hours in length

boardgame.name: Harpy's Nest (Remastered)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #5: Harpy's Nest provides you—the busy, time-crunched—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the harpy nests in your campaign. Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Black Dragon Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #53: Black Dragon Lair provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the black dragon lairs in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Bidding Room: Underground
boardgame.description:
As an art agent in Bidding Room: Underground, you have been employed by powerful families to represent them in a secret underground bidding room for illegal artifacts. Your task is to spend their money wisely to get goods that are worth points. Additionally, you have secret tasks and privileges that will sway how you bid.

To set up, one player takes the role of auctioneer and deals each other player a face-down agent card that includes a breakdown of all 27 artifacts in the game, while listing that player's specific privileges, such as receiving extra money for winning certain types of auctions. The auctioneer records the starting funds for each player — $40-50M depending on the player count — and sets up the artifact deck by shuffling three gift cards with the 27 artifacts. Only 10-20 items will be sold during the game, with that number being determined by the player count.

For each auction, the auctioneer reveals the item, then conducts the auction specified by that item, such as an open auction in which players write bids on their personal boards and raise them, an auctioneer bid in which the auctioneer calls out amounts and players lower their hand to drop out, a sealed bid in which agents reveal their bids simultaneously, and a second price bid in which the winner pays only the amount of the second-highest bid. If the auctioneer reveals a gift card from the deck, this gift goes to the player who won the most recent bid.

The auctioneer tracks the funds that all players have available, and an agent must track their own holdings — and everyone else's — mentally. If they win a bid for more than they have, they must sell off previously acquired items at their listed opening bids to acquire funds.

Once the specified number of items have been sold, whoever has the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Diverse Roles: Clement Sector Career Catalog 3rd Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Independence Games is proud to present the third edition of our career catalog, Diverse Roles. This book presents 21 career tracks for use in building Clement Sector characters. These include careers such as Belters, Clergy, Marines, Politicians, Scavengers, Scientists, and much more. While these career tracks are specifically designed for use with Independence Games' Clement Sector setting, they can also be used with any Cepheus Engine or 2d6 SF RPG.

This volume also includes our non-random character generation system.

Within these pages are the tools to allow your players to create characters from a wide variety of careers. Some are honest jobs, some are illegal professions, and yet others are those which tread in both worlds.

boardgame.name: The Lost Sky Market
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The day of the annual Sky Market Festival has arrived! People have gathered from all over to behold the city on the back of the giant flying turtle. However, as the day wanes on and the Great Turtle is nowhere to be seen, it's clear something is amiss...

The Lost Sky Market is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 1st to 4th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 3.

This adventure contains 4 new monsters, 2 custom battlemaps, 3 new magic items and 2 musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Green Dragon Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #54: Green Dragon Lair provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the green dragon lairs in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Celestia: Matryoshburg
boardgame.description:
Additional city for Celestia, distributed at the FIJ in Cannes in 2022.

Rule:

At the end of a trip, place the aircraft on the Matryoshburg City. Each player chooses a bonus from the following three options:

Draw an Equipment
Discard one or more of the equipment cards in their hand and draw the same number again.
Put a Treasure back under their pile and draw the one above it.


Then move the aircraft to Heolia (the first city) to begin a new trip, WITHOUT PICKING an Equipment card as is usually done.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Floating islands in the sky

listing.notes: Shipping worldwide: 2 Please read Seller info below.

New
English language rules on Geek
Post to UK: £1.25

boardgame.name: Races of Everglow: Three Rule Set Edition!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's easy to be distracted by the colorful ponies that have laid dominion over the world of Everglow, but they are far from the only race that has carved out their own portion of things and demands recognition. From the whimsical flutterponies to the despised impure, these lesser races are given a chance to be known, from social mores to combat abilities.This Book Includes

10 Races either new or expanded from the campaign setting for PF1, 5E, and PF2
Cloven, Flutterponies, Gem Gnolls (new), Griffons, Punda (new), Krava (new), Phoenix Wolves, Purrsians, Steelhearts, and Sun Cats)
Satyr Options for Cloven, Punda, and Krava
Cloven - 4 PF1 Background Traits, 4 PF2 Heritages, 1 PF1 wizard Arcane Discovery, 7 PF1 feats, 2 5E feats, 8 PF2 ancestry feats, 6 PF1 spells, 4 5E spells, 3 PF2 spells.
Flutterpony - 4 PF1 Background Traits, 3 PF1 subraces, 4 5E subraces, 4 PF2 heritages, PF1 Unification option, 1 PF1 class archetype, 6 PF1 feats, 1 5E unification option, 1 5E class archetype, 2 5E feats, 2 PF2 class feats, 9 PF2 ancestry feats, 5 PF1 spells, 5 5E spells, 4 PF2 spells.
Gem Gnolls - 4 PF1 Background Traits, 5 PF2 Heritages, 7 PF1 feats, 1 5E feat, 12 PF2 ancestry feats.
Griffons - 9 PF1 subraces, 9 PF1 Background Traits, 9 5E subraces, 10 PF2 Heritages, Hippogriff race for PF1 and 5E, 6 PF1 class archetypes, 2 PF1 weapons for griffons, 4 PF1 Equipment Qualities, 1 PF1 wondrous item, 16 PF1 feats, 6 5E archetypes, 2 5E weapons, 5 5E magic items, 13 5E feats, 2 PF2 weapons, 10 PF2 class feats, 15 PF2 ancestry feats, writeups for the griffon gods (Sun King, Huntress, White Talon) for all three editions, 5 PF1 spells, 5 5E spells, 3 PF2 spells.
Punda - 4 PF1 Background Traits, 4 PF2 heritages, 8 PF1 feats, 4 5E feats, 10 PF2 ancestry feats
Krava - 4 PF2 heritages, 6 PF1 traits, PF1 Unification option, 9 PF1 alchemist discoveries, 13 PF1 feats, 5E Unification option, 4 5E feats, 6 PF2 class feats, 11 PF2 ancestry feats, 7 PF1 spells, 5 5E spells, 3 PF2 spells.
Phoenix Wolves - 2 PF1 alternate racial traits, 3 5E subraces, 5 PF2 heritages, PF1 favored class options, 4 PF1 traits, 1 PF1 class archetype, 11 PF1 feats, 1 5E archetype, 3 5E feats, 2 PF2 class feats, 7 PF2 ancestry feats, 5 PF1 spells, 5 5E spells, 1 PF2 spell
Purrsians - 2 PF2 heritages, 4 PF1 traits, 1 PF1 archetype, 6 PF1 feats, 1 5E feat, 3 PF2 class feats, 5 PF2 ancestry feats, 5 PF1 spells, 4 5E spells, 4 PF2 spells
Steelhearts - 2 PF2 heritages, 1 PF1 alternate racial trait, 1 5E subrace, 1 PF2 magic item, 2 PF1 magic items, 1 5E magic item, 14 PF2 ancestry feats, 16 PF1 feats, 3 5E, writeup of The Maze covering all three editions, 4 PF1 traits, 4 PF2 spells, 4 PF1 spells, 4 5E spells
Suncats - 2 PF2 heritages, 5 PF2 ancestry feats, 6 PF1 feats, 2 5E feats, 1 PF1 Domain, 1 PF2 domain, 1 5E domain, 5 PF1 traits, 5 PF2 spells, 5 PF1 spells, 5 5E spells

boardgame.name: Horns of the Hunted (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A fabulous fey adventure for 6th-level characters!

Evil stirs in the depths of the Gnarled Forest. The heroes of the land, taming the wilderness and forging their kingdom, hear disturbing tales from woodsmen and trappers of a strange and ferocious hunting party ranging far and wide beneath the forest eaves. It is not only from human tongues that they hear warnings of these dread hunters, for the allies they have found amongst the fey and other woodland creatures are likewise deathly afraid of what these savage raiders may portend. The heroes are called upon by Myvenwy, a unicorn warden of the wood, who begs their aid in facing this peril, one that threatens her and her kind above all, but should the unicorns fall there will be none to stand against the raging Horns of the Hunted!

Horns of the Hunted is a 24-page Pathfinder Second Edition adventure for 6th level characters that is a great addition to your campaign whenever your heroes are feeling a bit too comfortable and complacent, as the wild world around them rises up in chaos and danger as otherworldly enemies intrude upon the mundane mortal world. Horns of the Hunted can be played alone or as a loosely coupled followup to Cold Mountain, and either adventure or any wilderness Pathfinder Second Edition campaign (like the upcoming "Making of Kings" Adventure Path) that features the fey can be greatly enhanced with upcoming products like new creatures and character options and ideas of Faerie Passions, fabulous fey magic within the Treasury of the Kingdom, or the terrifying monsters of the frozen forest in the Coldwood Codex and Boreal Bestiary! Featuring a desperate pursuit of mysterious fey both malevolent and benign, in Horns of the Hunted superstar author Matt Goodall has created a dreamlike and otherworldly feel that provides a memorable journey into the dangerous and deadly world of the fey that will Make Your Game Legendary!

boardgame.name: The Gnoll Sage (Issue 8 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this eigth issue of The Gnoll Sage, Fleabag tells us about the time he was part of the Court of Camelot, and gives us a dozen key NPCs from Arthurian legends for your game!

While this class is designed for the Chromatic Dungeons game, it is compatible with all or most OSR rulesets with little or no modification.

boardgame.name: The Troubleshooters Dice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Play The Troubleshooters as it was meant to be played with these custom dice!

This set of custom dice contains 7 six-sided dice and 2 ten-sided dice (one numbered 0-9 and one numbered with the tens 00 to 90).

Features:


Seven six-sided dice and two ten-sided dice in red with white faces.
Special designs on the six-sided dice makes it easy to read the results!

boardgame.name: Fallout Roleplaying Dice Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Resplendent in blue with yellow contrast for clear readability, this dice set has been custom-tailored for the Fallout tabletop Roleplaying Game. This set includes all the dice a single player needs and will cover all mechanics found in the core rulebook.

Includes:


20-sided Hit Location dice (x1)
20-sided dice with the VaultTec logo on the '1' face (x2)
Six-sided Damage Dice showing Vault Boy and blast marks (x4)

boardgame.name: Achtung! Cthulhu Dice Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A set of custom made Achtung! Cthulhu 2d20 crystalline blue dice, made to represent the Blauer Kristall which both Nachtwölfe and the Mi-Go crave, but which also contains a sinister secret lost in the mists of time.

Constructed under the personal supervision of Mina Wolff, the head of the Night Wolves, roll these bones to pass your skill tests and determine your fate, as you battle the forces of the Nazi occult and the evil influence of the Mythos in Achtung! Cthulhu 2d20’s Secret War.


This pack contains two x d20s and four x d6 challenge dice.
Translucent blue crystal look with white numbering.
Each die also carries a custom Secret War Squid symbol on one face.

boardgame.name: Mutant Chronicles Dice Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This polybagged set of Mutant Chronicles dice includes 2 Dark Legion d20’s, and 6 Dark Symmetry d6’s.

boardgame.name: Devil's Run Dice Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When the gangs tear up the freeway...
Choose a side. Fight. Survive
Two great nations that were destined to never find peace disappeared overnight. One is now an irradiated hot-zone where nothing survives. The other a sparsely populated wasteland that has plummeted into anarchy and chaos. Water, gas, and food are the only currencies that matter on a continent ruled by bullets, balls, and bloodshed.

The devil’s run roleplaying game puts you in the driving seat of a post-apocalyptic future in which gang warfare dominates. The rules of the road are none. All you need ask yourself is what would you kill for? What would you die for? How far are you willing to fall to survive?

Contains:


1 x dice set (pictured) for the devil's run rpg

boardgame.name: Infinity: Factions Dice Sets
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Boxed dice sets for the Infinity Roleplaying game, each containing:


2 x D20 faction dice
1 x hit location dice
4 x combat dice

boardgame.name: Dead by Daylight: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
In Dead by Daylight: The Board Game, a team of four resourceful Survivors face off against a single supernatural Killer in a high-stakes game of cat-and-mouse.

As one of four Survivors, explore the trial grounds, discover props, and utilize your unique perks as you work to uncover and repair generators. Repair four generators and open the exit games to escape and win! As a Killer, hunt down the survivors, wound them, and place them on sacrificial hooks to summon a sinister force. With enough sacrifices, you are able to appease The Entity and win!

Each turn, players will plan their moves by secretly selecting paths on the board to move along. Each time a player moves, they will reveal new features of the board, called props, which they can interact with to further their objectives or to hinder their opponents.

Survivors are able to utilize many different props to aid in their survival and navigation of the trial. Killers can make use of fewer props—instead, they interact with the Survivors using their attack or their unique power. Each Killer has a different power that will completely change the way the game plays. Both Killers and Survivors have perks which grant them special abilities. Experienced players can customize their characters with various perk configurations, offering even more replayability.

The basic game comes with 7 Survivors, 6 Killers, and 2 maps. The Collector's edition includes 17 Survivors, 16 Killers, 4 maps, and additional miniatures to create the ultimate Dead by Daylight experience.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lighthouse at Shipbreaker Shoals
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

The blazing beacon from the lighthouse at Shipbreaker Shoals used to be visible on every cloudless night. Just above the horizon line, the brightest star in the sky, a sleepless eye, slowly winking on and off as it rotated between Sagewood and the sea. After weeks of fog and rain, last night was clear… and the lighthouse was dark.

The town council of Sagewood meets and decides you must go to the lighthouse and discover what’s gone wrong! There are portents that someone—or something—wanted the light- house extinguished. It is up to you to uncover the mystery and see what has befallen the residents at the lighthouse at Shipbreaker Shoals.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Space Mafia
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The war between Galaxy Command and the relentless forces of the WARSTAR Empire may be the universe’s biggest conflict, but its far from the only one. And as Galaxy Command’s famous Galactic Marshals and other heroes are occupied by the conflict, forms of crime long thought eradicated flourish. An entire shadow economy, one based around murder-for-hire, weapons smuggling, trade in xeno-slaves and exotic chems, blockade running and high piracy, has emerged from the shadows.

boardgame.name: Opportunity Royal Oak
boardgame.description:
Opportunity is the family fun game featuring real local businesses as its properties. During the course of play you will buy, sell and expand businesses for profit, and face some of the same problems business owners and managers face on a daily basis. Players should find Opportunity intriguing as they match their intuition, decision making skills and luck against that of their opponents.

—description from the box

boardgame.name: D6 Danger System
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A fast-paced narrative roleplaying system for any setting.
...
What is the D6 Danger System?

It is a quick, narrative roleplaying game for a group of two to five people with simple, player-centered mechanics. The system is flexible enough to be used for different genres or settings, and it thrives in a story where the players are competent butt-kickers, ready to take down their enemies and solve problems on the fly with wit, grit, and a bit of screw it.

boardgame.name: Space Break!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In Space Break, all of the characters are inmates working together to escape the dreaded Sector 39 Interment Satellite. This module is designed to help a GM run a game using the D6 Danger System, which is a fast-paced, narrative roleplaying system. You will find adventure ideas, encounters, and game running tips below. Your characters are about to head into an exciting space prison break.

boardgame.name: Mazes Fantasy Roleplaying Reforged
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A modern take on the classic fantasy dungeon RPG. With a single polyhedral dice and the power of your imagination can you defeat the Maze Controller with swords, sorcery, and shadow? Lightning fast and easy to master, Mazes returns us to the dungeons where we first battled dragons with an award-winning, unique approach to fantasy roleplaying. Open the door to Adventure - if you're brave enough...

boardgame.name: Rolling Realms: Libertalia Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
The third promo realm is inspired by Libertalia: Winds of Galecrest. It features a crew of 2-digit "pirates" that can be completed in ascending order to earn benefits.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: crapland squared
boardgame.description:
From the book:

her name is Mel. you don't talk back to Mel FULL STOP. She has a telegram stop in her name. Also she has a razor sharp prehensile tongue that can saw bone in half. She has good taste in music and flames for an eyebrow. No one really understands it, but Mel FULL STOP. Feels no pain. FULL STOP. She's the leader of this crap group.

SOUNDS OF FIGHTING

boardgame.name: Vanquishing Darkness
boardgame.description:
An Introductory Campaign

From the introduction:

Vanquishing Darkness will be a 3-part adventure that pits adventurers against mid-air collisions, death cults, a new and terrifying Vampire coven, and, of course, the undead. The following adventure is the first harrowing chapter, Crash Course.

As this is a companion booklet, the Game Master (GM) and players are expected to have access to the Shattered Core Rulebook. The adventure is intended for 3 to 5 characters that start at session 1 with approximately 400xp (the standard amount for character creation). Each chapter may be played as a standalone adventure, in order— as part of the Vanquishing Darkness arc, or as a part of a GM’s own unique campaign

boardgame.name: 1941: Race to Moscow – Larger Locomotive Miniatures
boardgame.description: 26 black resin locomotive miniatures in 1:300 scale (35mm size) to be used with Giant Playing Mat accessory. This accessory is not required for use with the core game and does not change existing game play.

boardgame.name: Selfish: Disney Villains
boardgame.description:
Play as your favourite Disney villain in this devious strategy game in which you must overcome multiple quests to be the first to seize the throne.

Attempt to move closer toward victory while cunningly preserving your control and performing evil deeds to sabotage you fellow Disney villains.

This awesome game comes with 5 player cards, 5 player mats, 70 quest cards, 42 control cards, 24 evil deed cards, 1 throne card, 2 pile title cards, 1 guide and instructions. All compact inside a Disney villains themed box! This game is perfect for family road trips, or a night in with friends, making it the ideal birthday gift or Christmas stocking filler for Disney fans!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Two Trumps and a Lie
boardgame.description:
We aren't fans of not knowing fact from fiction, but sometimes you have to laugh to keep from crying. And what better place for a much-needed laugh than game night with friends?
So we’re taking an old favorite game — Two Truths and a Lie — and updating it for truly crazy times. Can’t tell the actual Trump quotes from ones that are completely made up? SAD. But hilarious! So Make Game Night Great Again!

—description from the designer

In turn, players are given a three statements from a card, read by the player on their right, and they must guess which one was not made by Donald Trump. If they guess correctly, they keep the question card; if they answer wrongly, the player who read out the statements keeps the card. After a set number of rounds, the game ends, and the player who has collected the most cards wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: CRUX: Universal Roleplaying
boardgame.description:
from the introduction:

CRUX: Universal Roleplaying is a roleplaying game system without a world to call home. But that's where you come in! It can be a world of high fantasy, where dragons soar in the skies and wizards cast devastating spells from lofty, impossible towers. It can be an interplanetary adventure, where pioneers take to the stars in seed ships as they search for new territory to call home. It can be a blood curdling tale of horror, wherein daring investigators struggle against the unspeakable terrors lurking in the shadows at the periphery of civilization.

CRUX can be anything you want it to be. It's an engine for generating stories with friends, and we built it as a place to explore our own ideas. If all of this sounds interesting you, CRUX might be your kind of game system as well. Join us; you're among friends. Read on, dream big, and make it yours.

boardgame.name: Arrakis: Dawn of the Fremen
boardgame.description:
Arrakis: Dawn of the Fremen is a brutal, cutthroat game about tribal control of Arrakis, more than a hundred generations before the Atreides come to Arrakis.

In the game, you control a tribe of Fremen warriors who are struggling to gather the scarce resources of Arrakis, develop the weapons and sietches you need to survive, and harness the power of sandworms for battle. Gameplay is split into three sections:


Harj — the final part of the game set-up in which players jockey for position
Initiation Cycle — the first cycle of the game, with a few restrictions to ease into gameplay
Cycles — each cycle is split into several phases, with cycles continuing until the game is won


You can conquer Arrakis two ways, by controlling the winning number of sietches at the end of the action phase or by unanimous decision of the council when all players agree that you cannot be prevented from winning...

—description from the publisher
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Dune Arrakis Dawn of the Fremen

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Doodle Face
boardgame.description:
Doodleface is a drawing game.....Potluck Style.

Instead of bringing your favorite food, bring you own interpertation of your friends facial features.

Every player gets a doodle pad and writing tool. Shuffle the appropriate cards and "Try your best" to draw your friends well. In future rounds themes get added for even more fun.

After all the faces are drawn, players vote on the best drawing. Who ever was the one being drawn, wins.

boardgame.name: Blackout (2021)
boardgame.description:
A witch on the roof of a scary old house. Black cats, cobwebs, and a crescent moon - all too creepy! In this point & click adventure, your task is to guide the main character Marilyn as she ventures deeper and deeper into a mysterious house in the middle of the night.

Blackout is a straight forward point & click adventure. Investigate, navigate, and use items to interact with things in your environment.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Nexum Galaxy: Fleet
boardgame.description:
120 plastic ship miniatures, with 4 different models and in different colours, according to each Civilization. Approximate size: 16 x 10 mm.

Collective Gnomicon (blue squad): They are cold machines that work like multisensory swarms endowed with collective intelligence. Greater potential: Supercalculation, with which they coordinate attacks and foresee many dangers. Against: They don’t feel, and do not take prisoners. Element: Information, predictive calculation.

Psychon (yellow squad): Highly energetic beings who dominate almost all frequencies. Greater potential: Electromagnetically alter the will of others. Against: Bad to win and worse to lose. Element: Energy, control of communication.

Clonix (red squad): Army composed of all kinds of cyborg beings that are drones, from an undisclosed galaxy, for what remains of the ancient human species. Greater potential: Military experience. Against: Absolute neglect of personal appearance. Element: Space-time. Exquisite punctuality.

Bionts (green squad): The deadliest combination of all life forms that they have assimilated in their travels through the galaxies. Greater potential: Defense and infection. Against: They are recognized by the strong smell of garlic. Element: Matter. Replica of any form of life.

3D Breeds designed the 3D starship sculptures based on Enrique Prieto's "Nexum Galaxy" universe.

Some of the were launched to exosphere as can be seen at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLCF6tqOihUKGVIceqNQUA...

boardgame.name: Nexum Galaxy: Playmat
boardgame.description:
Neoprene playmat: High quality and thickness, size: 21"x35 (55x90cm).
Improves the game experience for "Nexum Galaxy" and its expansions.

Compatible with many different space and sci-fi system games.

Designed by Matías Cazorla, based on Enrique Prieto's "Nexum Galaxy" Universe.

boardgame.name: Daerdan's Tall Tales: 101 Arctic Encounters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement conveniently lumps all wintry and frigid areas into one: "the Arctic." In your campaign, the Arctic may just be a country painted white by winter; it might be a mountain range or just a lifeless tundra. While some encounters do require the adventurers to be in the frozen wastes far to the north (or south) of proper civilization, they are nonetheless versatile.

Whenever the supplement mentions "the Arctic" defer to the appropriate region in your own campaign. As you may find, there aren't even references as to whether the Arctic is in the Northern or Southern Hemisphere.

boardgame.name: The Waking Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An ancient desert tomb has been rediscovered. First by the Doomspeakers, over a month ago, seeking a base from which to further their blasphemous agenda. More recently, the tomb has been found by Golden Falcon Antiquities, who wished to loot its valuables.

Unfortunately for the Doomspeakers, they were far too successful. They entered the tomb, cleared some of its many traps, plundered its chambers to fund their operations, and captured the Golden Falcon expedition. But in the process of converting it into a new base of operations, they broke the seal on its innermost chambers and fell victim to its horrible secret…

Now, adventurers approach in order to rescue the Golden Falcon explorers, but they believe they are facing merely a trapped tomb and are unaware of the greater threat within.

boardgame.name: Terror in Altbach
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A dark time has fallen upon the small town of Altbach, not far from Zobeck and Hammerfell: Its children are vanishing slowly, one day from the fields, the next from the mills. Dwarven families have been attacked—the parents killed and the children nowhere to be found.

The disappearances and killings have brought the once-spirited town to a hush. Rumors of dark elves, goblin raiders, and ghouls echo in the local tavern. Many dwarves have left Altbach, and many others stay behind the safety of their locked doors along with their children. As a result, the forges have grown cold, and the gold leaf production has slowed to a crawl.

The mayor, Calmuresh Coppersmith, knows the town cannot recover until whatever is behind the terror is dealt with—the dwarven presence in Altbach, while small, is crucial. The mayor hires the adventurers to get to the bottom of the events, stop whatever or whoever is behind them, and find the missing children.

boardgame.name: A God-King's Folly
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This continuation of the Waking Tomb adventure expands the Southlands setting with higher-level danger and even richer treasures! Having entered the pyramid to determine the fate of a missing expedition in part 1, the heroes discovered a larger threat in the shrike plague.

This adventure assumes that the characters have already successfully navigated the first level of the pyramid and have located Mehmet, one of the employees of Golden Falcon Antiquities. The characters must venture farther into the pyramid, determine the fate of the other three employees who are believed to be on the second floor, put a stop to the Doomspeakers, and exterminate all the shrikes in the tomb before they become a bigger problem.

Now they must learn the origin of the shrike plague and convince Kanakht, now a powerful but tormented undead, to assist them in ending the shrike threat for good.

boardgame.name: Laboratory of the Clockwork Chirurgeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This continuation of the God-King’s Folly adventure leads to strange new realms! Having entered the pyramid to determine the fate of a missing expedition in part 1, the heroes discovered a larger threat in the shrike plague in part 2. Now things get extra-planar!

This adventure assumes that the characters have already successfully navigated the pyramid. Now they must brave all the planar dangers of Evermaw!

Following the defeat of the Doomspeakers at the Pyramid of Kanakht, the discovery of an arcane gate has led the adventurers to the Plane of the Undead. Here, in a hazard-laden fortress known as the Moldheim Laboratory, a cunning clockwork automaton performs cruel and obscene experiments—including further development of shrike mutations and the creation of new and unspeakable horrors.

The characters must travel to the Dry Lands of Mot, invade the menagerie of damnable curiosities, and sabotage the clockwork chirurgeon’s abhorrent studies for good.

boardgame.name: Ravenfolk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This volume reveals the runes of the ravenfolk, 6 new rune staves, various dangerous believers and assassins among the Southern ravenfolk, even new Backgrounds, an Open Sky domain, and a ravenfolk ranger archetype!

boardgame.name: Planar Bestiary
Planes (Planar Bestiary)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This volume reveals a range of wild and dangerous planar creatures, their powers, and their societies, including in-depth look at the Ahu-Nixta from Tome of Beasts, plus new dark angels, and new yugoloths—something to challenge every level of play, from CR 1/2 to 25 for your 5th Edition tabletop game!

boardgame.name: Zobeck
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All the joys of urban life are on display: a smorgasbord of magical items, the hidden magic and practices of a vicious rat-cult, the hardworking people of the Zobeck river docks, and the seedy underbelly of the Cartways. If that’s not enough, take it up with the praetors and their minions, found in a curious blue house near the Citadel….

boardgame.name: Warlock Grimoire III
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Within these dusty pages, uncover the secrets of the world—indeed, of the branches of the multiverse! Collected here are entire lost volumes of esoteric truths: the Warlock Grimoire 3.

Inside, find revelations and testimonials on monsters, magic, locales, and lore for fantasy adventures.

boardgame.name: Channel WON
boardgame.description:
Launching on Kickstarter soon: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/popsbejou/channel-won?r...

This just in! You are a budding reporter for Channel WON News and you are so close to catching that big break! The network has decided to bring a fresh new face to their news anchor desk and you are the final candidates. Channel WON has decided to put their reporters to the test in a one-day, all-out showdown to see who is the best reporter to land the job of prime time news anchor! Your goal is to travel the city, gather sources, and help report the best news stories of the day.

Channel WON is a semi-cooperative card game played over three rounds, Morning, Evening, and Nightly news. In each round, players will collect cards needed to report on leads revealed to them by the station head. Players will need to work together to add location visits and sources to each lead in the day’s lineups in order to report stories, but once a story is locked in for editing, only players who helped contribute to it receive credit. Build up your reputation while discrediting your opponents, but be careful! If any lead goes unreported or a story is inaccurate, the network ratings will fall. Fall below a one star rating and Channel WON becomes Channel None and you all lose! Earn the most points after three rounds and you will be labeled the newest anchor for Channel WON. Resort to anything to report everything!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Midwinter Maelström
boardgame.description:
The Shadow Kingdom Series

From the introduction:

A one-shot adventure in the mystical wylds of Varagnus.

boardgame.name: One Night Strahd
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

ONE NIGHT STRAHD serves to condense the full campaign experience of Curse of Strahd into a one-shot suitable for Dungeon Masters (DMs) of any skill level. It distills the 200+ hour campaign into a coherent short-form experience that supports three modes of play:

• Long Play: Roughly 12 hours, suitable for events such as Halloween.
• Mini-Campaign: Roughly 16 hours, generally broken into three sessions.
• Stage Game: Variable as needed.

boardgame.name: Mythic Magazine (Volume 15 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Content:

Variations: Randomized Worlds Generation
What If: Virtual Tabletops In Solo Role-Play

boardgame.name: Dikti
boardgame.description: Dikti is a fast, fun and reflexive game! Use the letters on the cards to create words that match the categories indicated and get rid of your deck before the others do! Multiple game variations guarantee hours of fun. It's a fast-paced game starring words.

boardgame.name: Pikti
boardgame.description: Pikti is a fast, funny and reflexive game! Get rid of your deck as quickly as possible by matching the pictures on the cards to the indicated categories, and stay ahead of the others on your way to victory! Many variations of the game guarantee hours of fun. A fast-paced game with pictures in the lead role.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Lotta Rome
boardgame.description:
The once thriving Roman Empire fell apart. Who can resist the temptation to claim some of the lands for themselves? Do you prefer vineyards or quarries? Or maybe you want a little bit of everything with some olive groves and an oil mill on top? All you need is to make a good trade: offer a beautiful antique theater in exchange or add a few precious diamonds… Divide and swap lands, outguess and bribe your opponents! Create a prosperous domain from the lots of Rome!

Lotta Rome is a simple strategy game based on the original "cut-and-choose" mechanic that will win the hearts of aspiring conquerors of all ages.

Before the start, all players are dealt with their personal set of buildings with the card of buildings, a pile of lands tiles (there are 5 types - fields, city, olive gardens etc), gems/cristals, choice cards of smaller and bigger lands, reminder cards and screens.

The game is played in 4 turns.

During each turn, players take top 5 tiles of lands and place them in front of themselves. Then they take 2 top buildings from the building card and place them on the 2 lands from the left.

Next, players take their screens and start divivding those 5 pieces of lands into 2 groups - a bigger and a smaller ones. In any ratio they want (3\2, 1\4 even 5\0). And add 1 crystal to the smaller land.

When everyone is ready, the exchange begins.
Players put the screens down allowing other players to see and choose a land that they have made.

Note: at the first turn players choose the lands from a neighbour from the left, at 2nd - from the right, and then again left and finally right. For the max interaction

When selection is made, players put a choice card reflecting their decidion of lands.

Then, players take the chosen lands from the neighbour from the left and join them to the remaining piece of their own.

Turn by turn, they build their domains, taking the most suitable lands to make their so-called new empire more profitable.

How to gain points?
For every kind of terrain with the corresponding building placed on it or next to it. Then the number of lands multiply with the number of buildings for EACH type of lands.
The crystals gained for choosing smaller lands also bring points - 3 points for each crystal.

The player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Po prostu P
boardgame.description:
Simply P is a twisted party game from Trefl where you must tell other players the secret password. The challenge is that you can only use words that start with the letter "P" for hints! It's not that easy, is it?

Just give the correct hint! Earn points - dumplings! Beat your opponents with ingenuity!

boardgame.name: 5 sekund
boardgame.description: Do you like adrenaline? You'll like 5 seconds! A new version of the iconic party game where you only have 5 seconds to answer a question. Draw a card and count down the time using a special timer. Hurry, you only have 5 seconds...

boardgame.name: 5 sekund junior
boardgame.description: Special Edition is another installment of the crazy and fun family game 5 Seconds Junior. In this version of the game, the questions were created by kids and parents with little and big players in mind!

boardgame.name: 5 sekund Junior 2.0: edycja 2019
boardgame.description: 5 Seconds Junior Edition 2019 is a specially prepared edition of the iconic 5 seconds game with kids in mind! Surely you can easily name 3 flavors of jam - but can you do it under time pressure? Hurry up, you only have 5 seconds

boardgame.name: 5 sekund Harry Potter
boardgame.description: Hello Wizards! A brand new, unusual version of the bestselling game 5 Seconds, set in the world of Harry Potter! Do you think you know everything about the adventures of Harry, Ron and Hermione? Do you know every corner of Hogwarts, every spell and potion ingredient? But can you do it under time pressure? You only have 5 seconds, so jog your memory and don't delay in answering.

boardgame.name: Das Gespenst in der Schule
boardgame.description:
Small escape room adventure directed to children. Your friend has disappeared, and it is rumoured that there is a ghost in your school.

A deck of 34 cards, including story and puzzles to solve along the way.

boardgame.name: Ego Pictures
boardgame.description:
Ego Pictures is the next instalment of the social game EGO. Thanks to the pictures you will get to know each other better! There is no wrong answer here! The main attraction of the game are the pictures. Choose for yourself, which picture you like best and which you like least. Which picture best represents the drawn text? The task of the other participants is to guess your choice.

Do you think that the other participants know you well?

You will soon find out!

boardgame.name: Ego Emocje
boardgame.description:
Ego Emotions is a brand new installment of the popular party game in which players are tasked with determining their approach to various, often non-obvious and surprising topics.

Test how well you know your family and friends! Pick one of over 300 words and read it out loud. Do you have a positive, neutral or negative feeling about the word on the card? Use the emoticon to mark your answer. Don't let the other players guess your answer. The player who can best work out their opponents is the winner.

boardgame.name: Ego Family
boardgame.description:
The gameplay rules for Ego Family are the same as for other versions of this popular item. You draw a card with one of 330 trivia questions, answer it in secret. The other players guess what answer you have chosen. In this version of the game, the questions are divided into three types:

"Who among us...?" with these questions being answered by one of the players. Note that it could be you. You use a token to choose the player you think the question fits best.

"How many people among us...?" for these questions you choose the number of players from 4 possibilities: "No one", "One person", Two people, "More than two people".

Questions about only you. You answer them by choosing one of the four answers on the card.

boardgame.name: 24 Hours Escape: Lupin der Meisterdieb und der große Coup
boardgame.description:
The skills of Arsene Lupin are needed to solve an art counterfeiting case in Paris. The story follows a book format, where puzzle solutions tell you to which page you should continue. The book can be played through in a single session, or it can be split into two sessions at a recommended spot.

This escape game is full of tricks, creative ideas and criminal energy. Each puzzle is illustrated and puts the master of crime, France's most notorious crook in a brilliant light. Accompany Arsène Lupin alone or with up to four players through a unique escape game through the winding streets of old Paris.

boardgame.name: ブーケ〜花束を君に〜 (Bouquet ~Bouquet for you~)
boardgame.description:
ブーケ〜花束を君に〜 (Bouquet ~Bouquet for you~) is a card game from Japan. Players build up a hand of flower cards to form bouquets by getting cards into sets in the style of Rummy. Pairs, runs, flushes, various card combinations work to score. Players can exchange flower cards and use a butterfly piece on the cards to add to their score.
user summary

boardgame.name: Epoca Moderna
boardgame.description: Epoca Moderna is a board game (Eurogame) of geopolitical, economic and military strategy set in the present day, where you have to rule nations as president. Through the mechanics of the month-by-month worker placement you control your statuses. Manage the economy, expand your influence, fight other countries as a wise and successful leader. Vote, import and export resources, invest in the stock exchange, construct buildings, produce materials and fulfill orders to obtain goods, increasing your territory without forgetting the morale of the population. Governments, political ideologies and official religions for an asymmetrical way of developing their own civilization at will. These and other features await you in a one-of-a-kind title! Are you ready to make your empire prosper?
