Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Orrinyath's Guide to Dragons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the dragons down with new rules for aerial combat that make use entirely of ordinary Strength saves, Athletics checks, and attack rolls, no new flight modifiers or vector bonuses or anything else to remember, but which still prevent the fight from bogging down into a bizarre hovering melee. Once the battle is won, dive into the many uses in magic item crafting for dragon parts, from turning dragon teeth into +1 arrows to consuming dragons blood to supercharge the next spell you cast.

Challenge the ultimate enemy with new elite moves for all five chromatic dragons at each of young, adult, and ancient stages for a total of fifteen new movesets, turning dragon fights into the cinematic and tactically intense battles that they should be. Each set of elite moves comes with four special abilities, one of which may be activated each round, from breath weapons to Sorcerer spells to a dramatic takeoff that knocks down nearby creatures to superheating the air surrounding them to divebombing targets and more. After each elite move has been used across four different rounds, the dragon can then use their ultimate attack on the fifth.

And, of course, there are new rules for playing as a dragon or half-dragon. If you’ve been following the series, you knew that was coming, it’s the obvious direction to go. Beginning with a fairly basic natural weapons and flight, as you gain levels and attune to your draconic nature as though to a magic item, you will unlock higher unarmored AC from thicker scales, immunity to the appropriate damage type, a frightful presence, and limited Sorcerer spellcasting for spells related to what type of dragon you are.

Challenge the ultimate power or become it, with Orrinyath’s Guide to Dragons!

boardgame.name: The Stygian Door
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original level 3-4 short adventure made for D&D 5e.

A recent landslide reveals a gate leading underground. The entrance bears the unholy symbol of Chernobog, the black god of misfortune and ill luck. What lies beyond the midnight door?

boardgame.name: Spheres of Origin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Who you Wish! As you like it!

An infinite variety of adventures wander this world, shaped by circumstances mundane and magical into unique individuals with distinct abilities and approaches.

Spheres of Origin allows players and GMs alike to customize their characters and backstories to their liking, offering the tools to design unique Origin Traditions that emphasize distinct experiences and unique advantages.

Making up these Origin Traditions are talents from three all-new Origin Spheres, more than a 150 unique abilities which can be used to shape a character’s Aptitude, Essence, and Form into
whatever shape best suits their concept.

Building on the system of Origin Traditions and Talents are a variety of other options for players to develop characters as they see fit.

Revised rules for Favored Class Bonuses and Subordinates expand the possibilities for each of these systems, while new class options for the Conscript and Shifter classes expand the options and possibilities of Origin Talents through all character levels.

Finally, a number of new feats, revised magic talents, and the expansive Generation Tradition system offer a number of frontiers and options for players and GMs to explore.

With Spheres of Origin, players and GMs alike are given new power to make their game world their own.

boardgame.name: Burned
boardgame.description:
One player takes on the role of The Agency (including The Director), while the other player takes on the role of a Rogue Operative.

The Agency knows who their opponent is, but not where.

The Rogue Operative knows where their opponents are, but does not know which is the Director.

The first to die loses.

Burned is an aggressive and unforgiving game intended to be quick, tense, and re-playable, with a healthy dose of luck.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Campaigns 1: Protectorate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a catalogue of the characters that appeared one of the more recent campaigns I ran. It features not only the PCs but the Major NPCs and Monsters they met.

The basic concept: Invasion - two alien groups are seeking a way to subjegate earth.

This product uses the OSR mechanics developed by Night Owl Workshop as used in the Guardians.

boardgame.name: The Lamentable Companion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lamentable Companion is a set of extra rules for Lamentations of the Flame Princess, intended for players and referees alike.

Inside this companion volume you will find:

Background professions and skills for player characters
Expanded henchmen rules suitable for campaign play
Rules for using cannon in ship combat
Random mutations
Demonic pact rules including a player character respawn system
Downtime rules to help fill the blanks between weird adventures

boardgame.name: DiceCulus
boardgame.description:
DiceCulus is a fun and useful game, suitable for all ages. Make your children's school studies easier, or make a one-of-a-kind party.

The rules are simple enough, so that everyone can easily grasp them, but challenging enough to keep you interested. The game develops not only logical thinking and combinability, but also communication skills and - most importantly - makes algebra FUN!

A great gift for adults and schoolkids, the game comes in a luxury packaging and with an engraved wooden dice cup.
—description from the publisher

HOW TO PLAY:

Each player gets an empty writing sheet where they fill their results after each round.
Game consists of 4 stages and each stage has several rounds. In each round the first player draws the top card of the deck and puts it face up on the table. The card will contain a mathematical equation that could be as simple as "b-ac=" and as complex as for example "3bc/a - df/e =".
Players then spread out the dice around the equation's variables in their sheets, roll the dice and calculate their results based on the dice values and how they put them in the equation.
Each round has a twist on the main game rules. In one of the rounds you are giving points to the other players, so your goal would then be to minimize the equation's result.

boardgame.name: GLOSS #1: DCC Demi-human Classes in a Sword & Sorcery Campaign
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and easy rules for human characters using demi-human classes, and demi-humans using human classes in the DCC RPG. From the GLOSS series by MGSHP.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Graviton
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment will introduce a new villain – Graviton

This individual is able to manipulate the gravity in a given area to disastrous ends. He has created havoc all over the world and is now wanted by most law enforcement agencies,

boardgame.name: Police Stories
boardgame.description:
Police Stories is a fresh take on top-down shooters that elevates tactics and forces you to make split second decisions. Rescue civilians, disarm and arrest criminals. And remember – shooting first is not an option.

A top-down shooter, where tactical elements, advanced enemy AI and random occurrences create thousands of unique situations in each level.

You’re on the side of the law

You can’t go in guns blazing. Surprise the perps and make them surrender. Keep a close eye on those who yield and don’t forget to cuff them or you may get a bullet in your skull the moment you turn your back on them. Get the information you need out of them any way you can, but try not to push it too much – remember, you need them alive.

You can’t go in guns blazing

Surprise the perps and make them surrender. Keep a close eye on those who yield and don’t forget to cuff them or you may get a bullet in your skull the moment you turn your back on them. Get the information you need out of them any way you can, but try not to push it too much – remember, you need them alive.

Rick Jones, your trusted partner

Keep your fellow operative close at all times and command him at crucial moments – this will drastically improve your chance of success. Rick has a wide array of special equipment: he can peek through doors or blast them open, blind enemies with a flashbang and much more.

It’s never the same

Be careful – you will never know where the enemy will be and how he will react. It will make every playthrough feel different and provide a challenge every time you play.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 20 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tears of Ishme adventure path continues this issue with another 5e compatible adventure which can be combined with last months adventure or run on its own as a side quest. It fits any adventure that has a mountain in it!

We also explore love - not so much the soft and fluffy kind but the darker side when love turns to obsession and fanatical love in the service of a darker cause. All good fun we assure you! And this translates into new creatures, new magic items and new NPCs.

This is a fully illustrated fantasy RPG magazine that is system-neutral so fits for ANY fantasy RPG game system. Designed in a modern landscape format this is chock full of ideas for you as a Dungeon Master or Games Master.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral (adventure has 5e stats) Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Gaming Advice (6 pgs) - Using love as a motivator for NPCs, exploring love as a form of madness and how to use love for comedy effect
Godless beliefs (2pgs) - Cults that don't worship a deity but something else instead
18 Adventure hooks relating to the above cults
Tears of Ishme Adventure Path Episode Two (11 pgs) - (Can be run as an independent side quest) - Includes 3 new creatures with stat blocks, 1 NPC plus animal companion, both with stat blocks
4 detailed NPCs - 1 dutiful angel, 1 deranged necromancer, 1 ranger and their companion animal (from Ishme) and 1 chaos demon - all deeply in love with something
Hal and Rogers Creature Report - featuring four creatures
Magic Items - five new magic items introduced
Gaming Advice (3 pgs) - How to create and use double dice tables
Short Fiction (3 pgs) - A conversation in a bar about love potions
Love, Duty and Obligation - A personal view on love from the author
Picture prompt - 12 questions to prompt your creativity

boardgame.name: The Ascetic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Prestige Class for 5E from the Realm Scribe!

Becoming an ascetic requires years of self-deprivation and dedication. Hundreds of hours spent in fasting and meditation in harsh environments has innured you to pain and strengthened your resolve. Through this journey of self-denial you have deepened your connection to the divine and have begun to walk a path that will make you one with your god. As you progress further into this prestige class you gain the ability to bless your allies with a holy chant, strike with divine power, transcend your bodily limits, and become a direct channel for your god.

This class is for high-level campaigns that allow for multi-classing in order for a character to meet the requirements for this Prestige Class. It is designed to fuse together the concepts of the devout cleric and disciplined monk, and requires high dexterity and wisdom, levels in both the cleric and monk classes, and to be at least 10th level before taking a level in this class. Prestige Classes are very powerful and meant for high threat campaigns.

boardgame.name: Amazons vs Valkyries Character Spotlight: Arsinoe II
Arsinoe II: Pharaoh of Egypt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Character Spotlight series outline the main characters in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting, providing personalities and backgrounds which can serve as inspiration for your own adventures in this setting. Guidelines for using these characters as patrons, allies, or villains are also provided with D20 game statistics for each character at levels 4, 9, and 20.

In this issue, we take a detailed look at one of the most important and influential NPCs in the setting, Arsinoe II, Queen of Macedon, Queen of Lysimachia, and Pharaoh of Egypt.

Features:

Detailed character background
Campaign setting lore
Dozens of ideas for adventures
Personality traits
Use as a Patron, Ally, or Enemy
D20 stats at 4th, 9th, and 20th level

boardgame.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Rogue Archetypes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file covers the most common rogue archetypes in the Amazons vs Valkyries adventure setting.

These include:

The Investigator. Use your skills to track down criminals and fight crime!

The Outlaw. Use your skills to get ahead in life and become a bandit leader!

The Scout. Use your skills to conduct patrols, reconnaissance, and espionage!

The Trickster. Use your skills to distract enemies, entertain allies, and fool death!

If you're playing an Amazons vs Valkyries campaign, these archetypes are essential. If you're playing another Norse or Greek themed setting, then definitely check these out! And if you already have investigators, Outlaws, Scouts, and Tricksters in your games, you still should check out these cool alternates!

boardgame.name: Xanadu (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for Dungeon Crawl Classics, for character levels 1–2.

Welcome to the cult temple of Xanadu, an atmospheric temple-crawl for use with Dungeon Crawl Classics.

A cult in the temple of Xanadu has opened a portal to another dimension. It was activated by adjusting the hands of three pendulum clocks in a particular sequence. Once the veil of reality was ruptured between this world and another, The Tooth Fairy stepped through, a winged creature from a dimension made of sweet stuff. The Tooth Fairy slaughtered everyone in the temple for their teeth, which she extracted and ate like candy. Rumors are circulating about unusual happening involving the temple, many are concerned. The Tooth Fairy is currently in her dimension, her appetite is ravenous, waiting to be summoned again. Rewards and riches may await those who venture forth to explore the temple, or dare to perform the ritual!

Explore for treasure and magic items.
Solve how to complete a ritual that summons The Tooth Fairy.
Encounter and defeat some horrible foes.
Discover unusual books and maps, useful as hooks for further adventures.
Suitable for character levels 1-2.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Да оцелееш като родител
boardgame.description:
CONGRATULATIONS! YOU ARE NOW A PARENT!

This is where the fun begins. If you've been there before, you are in for an (un)pleasant return. If you're there now - you will be back to the daily terror instead of playing to relax. If you're about to do it - you may decide not to! Like we just said - congratulations!

—description from the publisher

How to play:
You step into the uncomfortable shoes of a parent whose sweet offspring brings him joy at the same time and seems to be trying to destroy him. All parents are different: there are businessmen and punks, politicians, managers, athletes, but they are all united by one thing - they try to survive without going crazy. Well, of course, and win. Each role has pros and cons, starts with different levels of health, sanity and money and has an individual special skill. There are two ways to win - you are either the last to be still alive or the first to get to 30 health and sanity.

MECHANICS
Before starting the game, do the following:
Give a random parent card to each player. Return the unused ones to the box.
Put cubes to indicate the current levels of sanity and health (initial values ​​are marked on the parent cards).
Shuffle all the playing cards and create a deck. Place it in the middle of the table.
Give 4 cards to each player, as well as the starting money marked on their parent card. Three cards are then removed from the pile of cards and the top one is turned over so that it is visible to everyone.
You are now ready to begin. Each action in the game is determined by the cards you play or are already in front of you.

FIRST ROUND: The last person to have become a parent takes the three cards without bidding anything, the other players take one card from the deck. If there is no parent between you, skip the first round and start directly from the second.

EVERY NEXT ROUND: You bid for the three cards visible on the market. With shouting, cunning, insults and everything. The one who bets the most wins. There are no restrictions on bidding - you can always intervene. The one who wins the bidding takes the three cards he has bid for. The others take one card from the top of the pile. The winner of the bidding starts first and can play as many cards as he wants - without restrictions. After him is the next player in clockwise direction. When everyone is done, it's time for the next round, which repeats the second round. And so on until a winner is announced in one of two ways:
Either the last survivor or the first who reaches 30 health and sanity.

boardgame.name: Kamikaze 1946: Divine Wind
boardgame.description:
What if Word War II hadn’t ended in 1945…?
What if the Manhattan Project had been delayed…?

The historical end of the Japanese Empire occurred in August 1945, before the invasion of Japan. For over 60 years, historians have debated what could have happened if a number of events had ended differently. Kamikaze 1946 proceeds from a historical base to describe what could have happened if the war had continued another year. Now you can participate in historical or what-if missions and aerial combats of WWII.

Kamikaze 1946: Divine Wind accurately recreates the speed and deadliness of air-to-air combat in a fast moving game system. Based on historical combat results, aircraft characteristics, and tactics of the aces, the simple rules are easy to follow. Most missions can be completed in 1-2 hours, with 2-8 players. Each player can easily control a dozen or more aircraft. The rules and data you need are contained within, along with information on painting 1/300th scale aircraft from Luftwaffe 1946 Miniatures. Can you alter the path of history?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Business Tycoon
boardgame.description:
The board game starts off with each player creating an LLC and borrowing money from the bank.

The LLC start the process of purchasing assets and either making a profit or running into liabilities. Another LLC can even aggressively take over an asset owned by a rival LLC.

The LLC that can withstand making a profit after paying the bank back the loan plus interest is the WINNER.

Great family and friends game. A fun way to introduce the topic of entrepreneurship to anyone from age 8 to age 80!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Anastyr
boardgame.description:
Between the time that saw the sinking of Atlantis and the great flood that was to cover the world, there was an unsuspected Bronze Age. An age of legends, raw magic and conflicts in the lush jungles and steaming swamps that would one day become the Mediterranean Sea. Heroes from all over the continent embarked on a Homeric quest to save the world from the threat posed by Anastyr, the queen of dragons.

Anastyr is a cooperative board game with miniatures for 1 to 4 players. Each player takes on the role of a powerful hero, and your team of heroes embarks on an incredible odyssey through a world where they will face hordes of enemies and monsters, wizards and warlords, all very different depending on the environment in which they live. Each hero has their own equipment and fighting style that will each evolve during the course of their journey; all hoping to be powerful enough to face the ultimate threat at the end of this epic, adventure-filled campaign! During their quest, heroes will ride a variety of mounts (horses, raptors, saber-toothed tigers and other exotic creatures) that will give them special advantages, and their combat skills and ability to coordinate with their companions will be tested constantly.

Anastyr has some particularly immersive innovations, such as scrolling tiles, interchangeable magnetic mounts, and backdrops that turn your game board into a beautiful diorama. The game features a dynamic mix of playing cards and special dice to roll and introduces combat mechanics loosely based on brawler video games. Heroes eliminate their opponents by unleashing fearsome combos. But they will also be able to ravage the battlefield with their Fury, a devastating attack resulting from unleashing their rage that has accumulated over the course of the battle. Each hero has a unique deck, which reflects their individual fighting style. And in the campaign mode, this deck can be improved by the player by the addition of new cards they can choose which will reflect the evolution and the leveling up of the hero over time.

Anastyr is easy to learn, but also fast, tactical... and brutal!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Anastyr: Boss Battle Terrain Elements Expansion

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Sapience
boardgame.description:
What does it mean to be “sapient”?

In a far off star system, the descendants of two starship crews scheme and fight a shadow war to determine if there’s hope for peaceful co-existence, or if the future will be one of violent human supremacy.

Embroiled in this war are the sapient Apes, Octopuses, and Androids uplifted by humanity but kept in servitude and slavery. Should intelligence grant autonomy? Is freedom a basic right, or is it a privilege? Do you owe anything to those who made you intelligent?

Sapience is a Scifi Tabletop RPG set in a far off cluster of space. Players can play as Humans, Androids, a mysterious goblin-like alien, or an uplifted intelligent Orangutan, Gorilla, or Octopus. The base theme of the game is exploration of privilege and discrimination, as humans do not treat the animals they have uplifted very well, and the setting features a cold war (essentially mirroring the US civil war) between the factions who treat the uplifts as animals and those who treat them as people. Or if these themes are too dark, then they can simply be ignored and the game can be enjoyed as a space opera with uplifted animals and androids!

(Attribution: publisher blurb, written by me, linked in the description in Drivethrurpg)

boardgame.name: Na jagody: moja pierwsza gra
boardgame.description:
The heroes of the Baby Boomers and Teddy Bear series set off on a forest adventure, picking delicious berries along the way. How many berries will they be able to collect before they reach Teddy's hut? Simple rules, spacious game board and large wooden elements make the game perfect for beginning the adventure with board games. Great fun in the company of characters loved by the youngest.

Colorful board, large pieces and spacious house make the game more attractive for children. Instead of pawns, wooden characters move around the board, so children can impersonate their favorite fairy tale characters. A standard die with dots is replaced here by a multicolored wooden dice, so even toddlers who can't count yet can play their first board game.
The manual also encourages players to play the cooperative variant, in which all players collect berries to a common basket. This way, rivalry will be eliminated from the game and the little player can focus on having fun, enjoying the time spent together and teaching cooperation.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Reise nach Paris
boardgame.description:
The game about traveling by train from Berlin to Paris and return.

Objective: be the first reaching start/finish stop called Potsdam Gate (Potsdamer Thor).
Roll the die and move forward. If you land on one of the special spaces follow instructions.

The game board shows seventy one beautifully executed views (hand colored) of places along the Berlin-Paris route in 1850's (Paris without Eiffel tower at that moment).

—user summary

boardgame.name: Rallye Interplanetaire
boardgame.description:
Rallye Interplanetaire is a French promotional space game from the Fromageries Bel company producing the popular line of Laughing Cow Cheese products.

The game is a simple roll and move mechanism where players move cardboard rockets along a path in the cosmos. Certain spaces on the course can advance or delay the players journey to reach the moon. First to reach the moon is the winner.

The company put out a number of these promotional envelope games during the mid 1950s, with Rallye Interplanetaire being Number 7 in the series.

—user summary

boardgame.name: How Robo-Santa Stole Christmas
boardgame.description: Publisher Blurb: A Christmas dinner goes horribly wrong.

boardgame.name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire Board Game
boardgame.description:
Bring home the nation's favourite game show and go head-to-head with your family and friends in the race to reach £1 million.

Relive classic moments from the show and tackle the iconic money ladder using only your wits and digital lifelines (accessible through a smart device) to reach the top. But watch out! Get a question wrong and you fall back to your closest safe haven.

Do you have what it takes to win a (virtual) million?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Glatisant (Issue #25)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue #25! In celebration of the Questing Beast channel hitting 50,000 subscribers, I’ll be giving away a stack of 9 RPG books on March 4th to one lucky subscriber to this newsletter.

Reviews
Podcasts and Livestreams
Free Kriegsspiel Renaissance
News
Theory and Advice
Art
Worldbuilding
History
Rules and Game Design

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#1 - Hunter's Moon: Tengu Dreams)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blaster Bolts is a new zine that features material for White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying and short science fiction.

This inaugural issue of Blaster Bolts features

A new playable race by system creator James M. Spahn - the stout and hearty Twergs
A new story by scifi writer Walt Robillard set in his Hunter's Moon universe
Two pregen PCs and an adventure hook that tie into Robillard's story

boardgame.name: Blaster Bolts (#2 - Hunter's Moon: Yield to Overcome the Snow)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blaster Bolts is a new zine that features material for White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying and short science fiction.

This second issue of Blaster Bolts features:

New Hunter's Moon story by Walt Robillard with accompanying adventure.
New White Star RPG content on Advanced Robots by James Michael Spahn.

boardgame.name: The Royal Mausoleum
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure shard for a party of level 7 to 9 heroes who oppose the undead.

The Royal Mausoleum is designed to prevent the creation of Undead, and prevent their access. But beyond that, its power over souls means that the undead cannot even touch its shores.

All of this - and yet it still hides a fragment of the Deathless One's soul.
The Extended Challenge rules-set is included alongside the Adventure Shard allowing you to make use of a new subsystem for deeper non-combat challenges.

boardgame.name: Esoteric Organizations: Mistress Saint's School
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Welcome home.”

Throughout the world there are some individuals who practice arts that even among the mystically inclined might seem strange. There are still others lonesome souls who think thay they alone shelter the dying flames of fading arts. Such individuals are never so alone as they might think. Somewhere there is a group of like minded practitioners waiting for them.

Welcome one and all to the hallowed halls of Mistress Saint’s School for the Uncommonly Blessed.

This document includes the following:

The basic rules for akashic organizations, including an introduction to Emblem Veils.
The stats and lore of Mistress Saint’s School For The Uncommonly Blessed.
Fallen Scribe’s Wings, the emblem veil of Mistress Saint’ School.
A new and powerful akashic monster, the Enochian Angel.

boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 02
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

This collection contains:

A backpack that holds a lot and feels nearly weightless
A skin that turns any liquid into pure, cool water
A compass that tells direction, and points to precious gems
A purse that pulls back all coins taken from it

boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 03
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

A drinking mug that makes you more persuasive as you get more intoxicated
The biography of the ancient dwarven king Anderakk
A quiver that gives an advantage to arrows placed in it
The key to Charrasco - whatever that is

boardgame.name: White Out
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ask anyone who travels the lands and waters around Rûl’s southern reaches and they’ll tell you there’s not much to see, unless you have a hankering for snow, ice, the occasional walrus, and more penguins than you know what to do with. People live here, naturally, and what passes for civilization in these parts can be found in the war-torn battlefields of the Patchwork Lands and, perhaps, in the Kingdom of Skulls to the east, but the road to real civilization, Blötland, passes through a particularly harrowing stretch known as the Blasted Lands. And here, in this windswept, blasted expanse does the group find itself hunkered down and waiting for a nasty to storm to blow itself out before they resume their march to wherever it was that they were going.

White Out presents a challenging adventure for a group of expert characters trapped in a dangerous place where they must wait out a blizzard. The adventure ends when the storm abates, preferably with the various mysteries solved and the threat hidden among them and the other survivors neutralized. Although set in the Blasted Lands, you can adapt this adventure for any setting during a harsh winter season.

boardgame.name: The Fall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is the last in a series of adventures that make up the Fall of Mith campaign. The fifth and final installment in the series. Anyone who owns all of the one-shots will be entitled to a PDF copy of the full campaign, coming soon.

The Fall:
The Fall is a three session adventure taking place to end the Fall of Mith. But it also designed to be able to be chopped up and put into any campaign. It's designed for four level seven adventurers to partake in. Its main story hook is following the Fall of Mith story. You can also run it as a series of battles elsewhere in your world, in a bit of a siege campaign storyline. Though the one of the battles (which takes place at sea) will probably have to be put to stay on its own unless the party conveniently is traveling across a sea at the end of your own story.

The adventure itself is made up of three to five parts, depending on the party's decisions. The first that all parties will come across is a simple one of helping the Mithians fight off and invasion from extraplanar fiends and undead through portals. The second is up to the party if they wish to help the Mithian leader try and defeat the enemy leader. The third (second) is the breaching of a great wall that's been constructed to defend the magic portal allowing the undead and fiends to invade the material plane. Next the party will either need to choose one of two possible ending paths if they have not done well enough. If they have then they will be able to participate in both, with two different final boss fights for them to participate in.

Adventure contents:
Five fully furnished color maps. With an appendix for all versions of the map without the DM numbers on it.
Three custom major NPCs with custom stats and pictures.
Ten new custom monsters/NPCs each with stats and pictures. And numerous returning custom monsters and NPCs.
The thirteen legendary items designed to scale that they may accompany the adventurers throughout their travels. While none appear in the adventure they are included in their own PDF as promised when I kickstarted this.
Six new (and many returning returning) custom magic items. Two of the items also have pictures.
One custom feat designed around a Mithian combat style and a number of blessings to reward the party with.

boardgame.name: Depths of the Earth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the bowels of the Earth

You've been following this tunnel for some time - ten minutes, perhaps? It should lead you to the vertical shaft and the lift, your closest way out of this maze-like abandoned mine. Your light source is dimming with each passing minute, and you can feel the pangs of pain in your ankle after your last tumble in the near-absolute darkness. You gather your willpower and take a deep breath, staring at the two identical passages in front of you. The corridor splits here, and you find yourself at the crossroads...

Wayfarer's Deck: Depths of the Earth invites you to venture deep into mines, caves, tunnels, burrows, and dungeons. Discover fabulous treasure, encounter other travelers and suspicious cracks in the ceiling, get uncomfortably lost, find traps (hopefully not too late!), and explore the marvelous and dangerous underworld.

boardgame.name: Minotaur Den (Remastered)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #6: Minotaur Den provides you—the busy, time-crunched—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the minotaur dens in your campaign. Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Starfall Chantry (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lurking twixt the crag-jagged hills south of Dunstone sit the ruined remains of an old dwarven fortress-temple. Rusted helms and broken blades jut from the surrounding soil like cast-off husks of iron grain, betraying the area’s violent history. Over the centuries, thousands have fought and died to possess this land, staining the earth with the blood of the slain. Three centuries ago, it took the very sky to fall to put an end to this ceaseless bloodshed. Today, however, the scars left by that same cataclysm may be enough to rekindle the old flames of war.

boardgame.name: Starfall Chantry (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lurking twixt the crag-jagged hills south of Dunstone sit the ruined remains of an old dwarven fortress-temple. Rusted helms and broken blades jut from the surrounding soil like cast-off husks of iron grain, betraying the area’s violent history. Over the centuries, thousands have fought and died to possess this land, staining the earth with the blood of the slain. Three centuries ago, it took the very sky to fall to put an end to this ceaseless bloodshed. Today, however, the scars left by that same cataclysm may be enough to rekindle the old flames of war.

boardgame.name: The Water Leaper
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Water leapers, known as llamhigyn y dwr (pronounced roughly "thlamheegin uh duwr") in their native Wales, will attack almost anything, and regularly destroy the nets and lines of local fishermen. They also attack swimmers and livestock drinking at the water’s edge.

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #9)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this nineth issue:

For Infinity's Edge, discover new Specialist Classes: the Destroyer & Nightblade!
Continue exploring the Three Kingdoms in Part 5 of the new setting for Infinity's Edge!
We learn more about the new Nationality Traits for Thunderscape TinyD6!
In Thunderscape TinyD6, discover the horrors of Terrablix the Autonomous, king of the Dark City!
Find character inspiration in unused legacies of the Golden Age for Tiny Legacies!
In Random Heroes for Tiny Legacies, we meet Exile, the world's most arrogant hero!

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #10)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this tenth issue:

For Infinity's Edge, when you need some extra material... 12 Side Quests!
By popular demand from Kickstart backers, how about More Monsters for Infinity's Edge!
Discover soe of the Known Lands' most advanced weapons in Legendary Gunsmiths for Thunderscape TinyD6!
In Thunderscape TinyD6, ask yourself the question... Who Are the Fallen?
In Tiny Legacies, let's see who's on the bench in Reserve Members of the Adventure Society!
In Random Heroes, we meet Sister Sin, a villain turned hero for Tiny Legacies!

boardgame.name: ThunderZine (Issue #11)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the ThunderZine, the support 'zine for all of Kyoudai Games brands, including the Infinity's Edge Role-Playing Game, the Tiny Legacies line of sourcebooks for Tiny Supers, and Thunderscape in all its many forms!

The ThunderZine is developed for and with the members of the Kyoudai Games Patreon, who get it several months in advance of the public and who have the opportunity to contribute ideas and requests for specific content.

In this eleventh issue:

For Infinity's Edge, what's that glowing piece of treasure? It's 12 Magic Items!
Everyone loves Specialist Classes, like the Explorer and Shaper of Elements for Infinity's Edge!
There's something for everyone in the Merchant's Caravan for Thunderscape TinyD6!
In Thunderscape TinyD6, what mysteries might be discovered in Secrets of the Skar?
In Tiny Legacies, meet those most mystical of heroes, the Sons of the Dragon!
In Random Heroes, it's that strangest of encounters, the ancient and insane starship known as the Derelict for Tiny Legacies!

boardgame.name: The Unkindest Cut
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a routine detour to scavenge supplies turns into a rescue mission the survivors learn an important lesson about the value of trust.

The Unkindest Cut is the fifth episode in The Living Dead Campaign. This unorthodox Savage Worlds Plot Point Campaign for Dead End takes your Novice survivor characters through the first year of the zombie apocalypse with a recurring series of monthly episodes that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

boardgame.name: Can't Sleep - Clowns Will Eat Me (Elemental)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something wicked this way comes...
The good folk of Juniper's Crossing haven't slept a wink since the circus arrived, and not for lack of trying. People are starting to see things that aren't real, and—even worse—some things that are.

Can’t Sleep—Clowns Will Eat Me is one of the Ennie award-winning Trilemma Adventures by Michael Prescott. This version contains the original nightmarish mini-adventure, expanded to include ELEMENTAL stats and a flavorful cast of player characters with their own agendas and motivations.

Drop Can’t Sleep—Clowns Will Eat Me into your campaign or play it as a one-shot. Hand out the provided characters, and you can enjoy a session of gaming right away, with as little preparation as a board game.

boardgame.name: The Vivomancer Class for Old School RPGs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vivomancers are arcane casters that study life. If they are good then they act as Doctors treating the sick and injured, but not all vivomancers are so inclined. Many perform vivisections and horrible experiments in seek of knowledge, power, and immortality. Included in this document is the following:

Vivomancer character class
Spells
New magic items
Potion creation rules

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming Guide to: Pirates and Privateers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout history the term privateer and pirate were as closely related as freedom fighter and rebel. That is, depending on which view one looks from, the distinction is not always apparent. This was never truer as during The Age of Sail. This period was a time of plunder and prize, heroes and villains. The rise and fall of nations could be determined by the intrepid sailors who brought back treasures from the New World or stole those same treasures as they journeyed home. Naval dominance didn’t always go to the biggest or best armed. Speed, skill, determination and grit were just as powerful a force as an extra barrage of cannon.

Welcome to the Age of Sail.

Tabletop Gaming Guide to: Pirates and Privateers focuses on life during the days of pirates and privateers, known as the Age of Sail. This isn’t just another pirate sourcebook; military historian Christopher J.N. Banks takes you on a trek through the historical Age of Sail for characters that assume the role of naval crew, pirates, or privateers.

Tabletop Gaming Guide to: Pirates and Privateers includes:

A look into those who made their lives on the high seas
A delve into well known people and places
A ship construction guide
A look at battles on the high seas in ship-to-ship combat
Adventures to get things started
… and more!


Tabletop Gaming Guide to: Pirates and Privateers helps you get more out of your pirate games and characters. Play a historical game or take the historical setting and drop it into a fantasy game!

Tabletop Gaming Guide to: Pirates and Privateers includes the following How to Use guides for incorporating the source material quickly into your games:

Savage Worlds (SWADE-compatible)
Entropic Gaming System (EGS 2.0)
Legend

boardgame.name: Scene One, Scene 'Em All
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scene One, Scene 'Em All is the twenty fifth in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements." It's also the sixth in our Season Four series of zupplements, each detailing some of the influences that helped make #iHunt what it is.

It's a guide to subcultures and cliques, full of ready to play material for your #iHunt stories.

Inside, you'll find:

The Rules. Here, we lay out how to turn the clique into its own character sheet, with different rules depending on its size.
Sk8 Or Why: A group of skate punks keeping the long dead punk tradition alive. It's like necromancy, but for subcultures.
The Bees: A subculture of breakdancers that believe dance can help lead the world to more nonviolent solutions.
The PTA: It's as scary as it sounds. It's suburban moms that band together to bully school districts and I'm sure do other stuff.


The Occult Underground: A group of goths, witches, and conspiracy theorists that share secrets and tricks of the trade.

boardgame.name: The Labyrinth at Tarryton U
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep beneath the halls of Tarryton University are a network of secret corridors and halls of experiments long since shuttered and past. But when a group of overeager students uncover a long-forgotten labyrinth inhabited by minotaurs bent on bringing the hells to the mortal realm, only the bravest of adventurers can hope to stop it. Will you answer the call?

The Labyrinth at Tarryton U is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 4th to 7th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 6.

This adventure contains 5 new monsters, 2 custom battlemaps, 3 new magic items and 2 musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Zoople
boardgame.description:
Zoople is a tense dexterity game where you carefully build your zoo UPWARD! Score points as you balance animals one atop the other in any way you want.

Topple the zoo and you lose!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
MSRP USD 25
Korean only edition. (with only Korean rules) Shipping Cost: USD 30.0 - 45.0 according to the destination and shipping method.
Paypal : "imandoogames@gmail.com"

boardgame.name: Data Loss
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

YOU DIED. Each death steals more of your mind, obscuring why you came to this world, how it fell to ruin. You recall only a vague hope: Reclaim this planet from the metaminds — or escape it.

boardgame.name: Habs & Gardens
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

LIFE ON THE RING IS GOOD. There’s synth-meat in every pot, a gravcar in every garage, a hi-fi stereo in every living room, and a 25-hour cycle. (There just weren’t enough hours in the day!)
Consider it as a setting for adventures of a more mundane sort, a pleasant stopover in otherwise stressful space travels, or a mystery to be solved. After all, is anyplace really this good?
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: HEATED: The Spiciest Card Game
boardgame.description:
Rules are simple: Play your cards to match the color or card type to clear your hand first! With a plethora of SPECIAL CARDS to choose from, the round can change quickly!

And the great news is, it's Colorblind Friendly!

Don't have a card to play? Ask your friends to offer you a facedown card. They could be telling the truth and creating an alliance, or they could be deceiving you and creating an enemy!

HEATED is a commercial upgrade of Crazy Eights, a public domain card game played with a standard deck of playing cards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Age of Ambition: Expert Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A plethora of potential adversaries to harry even the mightiest heroes
The world of Trystell can be a daunting and dangerous place. This bestiary demonstrates just how deadly it can be, delving into a plethora of fearsome foes. From the greater elementals to cutting-edge lunar automatons, wherever the heroes may tread, adversaries and dangers await.

Age of Ambition: Expert Bestiary contains a treasure trove of new creatures to challenge even the mightiest heroes! It is a key supplement and its features include:

Almost ninety new monsters and other adversaries for the Age of Ambition roleplaying game!
Background on elementals, lycanthropes, automatons and how to use these enemies in your campaign.
Numerous stat blocks for masterful humanoid foes.

boardgame.name: Starfall Chantry (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lurking twixt the crag-jagged hills south of Dunstone sit the ruined remains of an old dwarven fortress-temple. Rusted helms and broken blades jut from the surrounding soil like cast-off husks of iron grain, betraying the area’s violent history. Over the centuries, thousands have fought and died to possess this land, staining the earth with the blood of the slain. Three centuries ago, it took the very sky to fall to put an end to this ceaseless bloodshed. Today, however, the scars left by that same cataclysm may be enough to rekindle the old flames of war.

boardgame.name: The Fruit of Untash
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An original D&D 5e adventure for level 3-4 characters

The heroes discover legends of an enchanted fruit growing in the hanging gardens of an ancient pyramid. The pyramid is not only a den of ancient traps and dangerous plants, but fiendish spirits nurture the magical fruit cultivated within.

boardgame.name: Castle von Loghan: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Castle Von Loghan - Deluxe Edition is a co-op, group-decision making, survival board game that offers a unique narrative and dungeon-crawling gaming experience. The game includes several game modes, such as Story Campaign and Exploration.

The Deluxe Edition comes with an additional Campaign Mission, a brand new game board, and additional game content.

Working together as one group, the players adventure inside Castle von Loghan where they will face an array of dangers but also will find several valuable treasures.

During each turn, players have to decide where to go next, solve the secrets of the room in which they have arrived, battle the enemies protecting it, then prepare for the next encounter.

The only route to winning the game is through survival — and to survive, they need to work together.

Notable mechanisms: Sharing of health and clarity, unique narrative events that require careful listening and decision making, a ten-game-long Story Campaign that is filled with the best RPG elements one could expect, easy-to-understand card-based tactical combat that comes with a variety of outcomes.

Intro to the story:

In 1970, inside the Albatross Scientific Institute (LOS ANGELES), a group of scientists make contact with a group of hyper-intelligent beings known as the CeDI (Celestial entities from the Downing Ipsys) who claim that humankind is doomed. They have brought with them some of their advanced technology, instructing the humans to make use of it in order to evacuate the Earth which, according to the aliens, will become uninhabitable in approximately 100 years. Aided by the scientists at the Institute, the aliens unlock G.O.D.O.S., an AI they have brought with them from their galaxy. They claim G.O.D.O.S. will help all of humanity... but the aliens seem to have a personal mission linked to G.O.D.O.S. as well; one which they haven’t revealed to anyone else. On the 27th of August, G.O.D.O.S. is activated.

A council is formed and, with the help of the aliens, they begin work on Project KARR. The goal is to build at least five ships that are not only capable of carrying about 1 billion people each, but can keep them alive for hundreds of years. The KARR also serve as colonization units. The news of the aliens and of Project KARR is shared, bit by bit, with the humans, and by 2067, the ships are ready to launch.

In 2068, the ships leave earth, leaving behind all those who refuse to go.

Each ship heads towards a different point in space in the hopes of finding a suitable planet to serve as a new home. They cannot go to the aliens’ solar system, since humans can not survive such a long journey or the interstellar travel required to get there. After several years in transit, the KARR-5 ship collides with a huge meteorite and is heavily damaged. Hundreds of thousands of humans die, and many of the ship’s sectors are damaged beyond repair.

In his desperation, a certain human decides to take matters into his own hands. Owning the only copy of G.O.D.O.S., a man named Deacon Padjin, the Prime Commander of the KARR-5, uploads G.O.D.O.S. to the KARR-5 ship’s operating systems. G.O.D.O.S. takes over the entire ship!

With the help of G.O.D.O.S., the ship is saved. Humans learn how to resurrect the dead by placing the “souls” of deceased individuals into androids. The newly-resurrected individuals, known as the Resurrected, remain ignorant of their death and subsequent resurrection. This technology becomes so advanced over the years, that it is almost impossible for someone to tell if they’re human or a Resurrected. The KARR-5’s population begins growing back to its original size.

G.O.D.O.S. secretly develops a semi-functional time-machine, but after extensive testing, the results are grim: it can only send people to the past, but it can’t bring them back, and it cannot send anyone into the future. G.O.D.O.S.

A few years pass; the KARR-5 is still stationary. Deacon Padjin, who is still deeply involved with the time-travel project, develops a module that allows time-travel to the future. After managing to remove G.O.D.O.S. from the ship's systems, he uses the time-machine to escape to the past, safely, taking the AI and some other people back with him.

The remaining leaders of the KARR-5 assess the situation and, after 10 years of testing and many different iterations, manage to partially replicate the time-machine. Having done so, about ten years later, they send a group of KarrSEC agents after Deacon and G.O.D.O.O.S. armed with a state-of-the-art tracking device, capable of following someone through time. As there have been no changes to their timeline, it is a widely-believed hypothesis that Deacon succumbed to an untimely death, either during the jump or as a result of it. However, the KARR-5 Council, and the KarrSEC, want to ensure that G.O.D.O.S. be dismantled so that it can’t make any modifications to the timeline, thus changing the course of History forever.

Meanwhile, the CeDI engage in secret meetings with some of the scientists from the Institute, informing them that the loss of G.O.D.O.S. will most likely have disastrous consequences. The CeDI finally reveal their true intentions: they need G.O.D.O.S. to break through a time bubble that has been placed around their planet in which an intergalactic battle is being fought. Without G.O.D.O.S., the CeDI will likely lose the battle, which could easily spread to other parts of the galaxy, a threat that none but the CeDI is prepared to face.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Sig: City of Blades
boardgame.description:
From the back of book:
Sig is the nexus of the multiverse, where eternal planes and infinite primes meet. It’s a rough home for cutters and bashers, hungry for coin and glory. It’s a city of gods, demons, and stranger things which lurk. It’s a place where opposites meet, trading knives and kisses in equal measure.

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 18
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce numéro vous propose une visite du Collège d'Arcanologie de Brasto, brièvement évoqué dans le tout premier numéro de L'écho éthérique. Cours, professeurs, matières enseignées et plan du campus : vous saurez tout sur l'une des plus prestigieuses écoles de magie d'Empyréa !

boardgame.name: Le Casse De Trop
boardgame.description:
Players take on the role of robbers who successfully pulled off an extremely risky job. Less than 48 hours later though, cops got them all. No doubt: someone snitched!

Each player chooses a character among the 10 available (the hacker, the demolition expert, the inside man, …), then let the cards guide you through the game and its very few rules.

The story will grow, one card, one answer at a time. Before you know it, an exciting story will unfold, filled with plots, backstories, action sequence as well as doubts.
One question remains however: did you sell out your mates or did you remain loyal?

The game ends with a Prisoner's Dilemma. Who will walk out free, who will be imprisoned for life? That's up to you to determine.

boardgame.name: Moon
boardgame.description:
Moon depicts an almost plausible rush to construct lunar bases that are attractive places to live and work for the people of Earth. The most prestigious base will become the new lunar capital!

The game employs the familiar "pick & pass" or "hand drafting" mechanism for players to select a new structure cards to add to their base. Each hand of cards represents a convoy of experts and equipment travelling between the players' outposts, giving the player the choice of one new construction each turn. In a new twist on the genre, each hand always contains one of a number of "Expedition" cards that grant a special free action every turn before passing on to the next player.

Wooden lunar rover tokens are a neutral resource that add a worker placement element to the game. They are also used to break ties and so must be used with care.

Over the three distinct eras of the game, players compete for majority in 5 aspects of their bases: housing, transportation, science, industry, and food production. At the end of each era, the leader in each of these areas as determined by flag icons on their constructed buildings, collects bonus victory points.

Each game also features a number of randomly selected "Reputation" cards which provide one-time or ongoing bonuses for the player who meets the requirement and claims the card.

Moon is the third game of a loose trilogy, preceeded by Villagers and Streets.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: HONK!
boardgame.description:
There’s a goose on the loose! Actually, there’s a LOT of geese and they’re completely out of control - you’ll have to round them up!

In this fast & fun family game, 2-5 players will gather food cards, collect chunky cardboard geese, and seek out precious golden eggs. Goose on the Loose is a simple game that helps introduces younger players to strategic games. It has low reliance on luck, and is designed to be fun for adults to play too!

On their turn, a player can either collect food or feed a goose. Each of the 8 different goose breeds has a specific diet, and so the correct food cards must be used to claim them. Feeding a goose rewards the player with an egg (worth 1 point each), and a bonus egg for each goose of the same breed already in that players' collection. The geese at the bottom of the pile conceal golden eggs, which are worth 1-3 points. The player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cave Creatures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Caves are mysterious places. Some caves have valuable ores and gems, others are used to shelter from the weather, and every now and then a creature uses a cave as their home.

This pack contains interesting monsters that can be added to your adventure.

boardgame.name: Devils
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

All hell breaks loose with this devilish token pack! The pack contains 15 tokens from our favorite RPG monsters rulebook. From Imps to Pit Fiends, we’ve got you covered.

Lead your characters into the infernal realms of hell, or bring fire and brimstone to the prime material plane. Whatever you choose, I am sure you will give them a hell of a time!

boardgame.name: Heroes 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This release is a pack of heroes of the more uncommon races of the fantasy realm. It includes the froglike Grung, the Tortle turtlefolk, Fairies from the feywild, the popular catfolk Tabaxi, and the Loxodon elephant folk.

Each token comes in multiple variations with different weapons and colors.

boardgame.name: Guards and Soldiers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“Guards!”. This is usually a signal for your characters to come in to jump into action to help someone that is in trouble. But occasionally your characters are the ones that are causing a villager to yell out for aid. Maybe one of your characters made an attempt to steal something but failed, or maybe your characters were attacked and are spotted near the corpse of the assassin.

This top-down token pack offers guards and soldiers to populate your towns and villages.

boardgame.name: Royal Court
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dealing with royalty can be an interesting part of your roleplaying game adventure.
...
In this token pack you will find all the tokens you need to represent a Royal Court. Including Kings, Queens, children, and staff.

boardgame.name: Dead and Wounded
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Finding the remains of a person can be a clue to lurking danger, it can be the subject of an investigation, or a quest by itself.

The tokens come in variations. There are some that are sleeping, dead, wounded, diseased, or burned.

boardgame.name: Circus
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Many of us can remember the moment that we were filled with wonder when we visited our first circus. It is a place that makes us believe that magic is real.

The circus is a great place for a fantasy adventure. Whether you want to introduce exotic NPC’s, or have your characters explore a haunted circus.

This pack of tokens offers you a variety of performing characters such as a strongman, acrobats, fire breathers, snake dancers, and animal trainers.

boardgame.name: Desert Creatures II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The desert can be a dangerous place. The heat and dehydration can bring anyone an untimely death, if they face the wastelands without any precautions. The creatures that live within the desert are usually incredibly resilient, or extremely predatory. But the desert can also be a place for amazing adventures.

Who knows what secrets lay beneath the sands?

boardgame.name: Aquatic Creatures II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The normal variations can be used for underwater encounters, and the half-submerged variations can be used for encounters at the surface of the water.

The shadows are there to scare your players. You can have a large creature follow around your players’ ship, without completely revealing what dangerous creature it is that is chasing them.

boardgame.name: Frozen Adventurers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When winter is coming, you better put on some warm clothing! These tokens are fully prepared for even the most frozen adventures that you can offer them.

We have characters that are wearing fur clothing, inspired by cultures that live and have lived in the most northern parts of our world.

Other characters are wearing armor and clothing inspired by nomadic folk that live on the steppes and in the mountains.

And of course I have included some vikings that are inspired by history and the more recent fantasy representations.

boardgame.name: Constructs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Modrons are interesting creatures. Where angels and demons are representations of Good and Evil, the Modrons are representatives of pure order. It is often confusing to try and understand what they want, but they act with purpose and dedication.

Gnome tinkerers have created all kinds of interesting constructs. Some of them are just toys, but others can be very dangerous.

boardgame.name: Artificers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The mad scientist is a strong archetype in the fantasy genre, and the Artificer brings that archetype straight into your roleplaying game.

They are often found in messy workshops covered in tools, gears, and other unrecognizable materials. Many people find them confusing and strange. But the Artificers create the most amazing magical objects or mechanical creatures.
